title: Senior Software Engineer SRE
description:
This is what you will do

At Odido, we’re on a mission to become the most customer-driven telco in the Netherlands—and our IT landscape plays a crucial role in making that happen. As Senior Software Engineer SRE, you are at the heart of service reliability, building and maintaining the systems that keep millions of customers connected—no matter how intense the traffic or how high the stakes.

You’ll be the technical lead ensuring end-to-end resiliency across our applications and infrastructure. From proactive monitoring to self-healing automation, you prevent outages before they impact our customers. Imagine this: it’s 3 AM, an anomaly is detected—your smart monitoring and automated scripts spring into action, rerouting traffic and neutralizing the risk before anyone even notices. The next day, your team dives deep into post-incident reviews, continuously improving how we work, learn, and scale.

You’ll work closely with SRE leads, platform engineers, and software teams to drive automation, reliability engineering, and observability at every level. Your expertise in fault-tolerant design, distributed systems, and DevOps practices will directly impact our ability to deliver seamless customer experiences—whether it’s over mobile, broadband, or fiber.

And if you have telecom experience—perfect. It’s not just a bonus here, it’s essential. We’re not just building any digital platform; we’re building for the unique demands of a high-volume, always-on telecom environment. Without prior experience in telecom ecosystems, we unfortunately cannot proceed with your profile for this role.

You’ll bring deep technical knowledge, a collaborative mindset, and a passion for solving complex problems in fast-moving environments. Together, we’ll raise the bar on performance, security, and customer satisfaction—every day.

You’ll be part of a high-impact engineering team, collaborating with developers, platform engineers, and operations specialists to continuously improve Odido’s service reliability, scalability, and efficiency. Your work will drive the automation, instrumentation, and observability that power Odido’s digital services.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Continuous Improvement: Oversee and enhance incident-response processes, ensuring lessons learned translate into structural improvements.
  • Automation & Application as Code: Develop reusable patterns for automation, configuration management, and deployment across teams and products.
  • Service Ownership: Take full responsibility for several critical services, ensuring high availability and reliability.
  • Incident Management: Lead or participate in outage response calls, quickly resolving incidents and minimizing downtime.
  • Monitoring & Observability: Design and implement proactive monitoring strategies using tools like Prometheus, Grafana, and Kibana to improve system performance.
  • Troubleshooting & Debugging: Analyze and fix system issues in a complex distributed environment and application stack
  • Engineering Best Practices: Advocate for DevOps and SRE principles, mentoring junior engineers on automation and operational excellence.

Must-Have Skills and Qualifications

  • Experience on NodeJs, Python and Rest Services
  • Experience with public cloud platforms (AWS, Azure) and related technologies (Docker, Kubernetes, CloudFormation).
  • Strong understanding of storage, database systems, caching, queueing, and networking.
  • Experience in leading technical recoveries and troubleshooting distributed systems.
  • Ability to debug, optimize code, and automate routine operational tasks.
  • Solid foundation in Linux or Windows administration and troubleshooting.
  • Strong knowledge of monitoring/observability tools (Prometheus, Grafana, Kibana, Elasticsearch).
  • Understanding of Service Level Agreements (SLAs) and Service Level Objectives (SLOs).
  • Proficiency in at least one programming language for automation and scripting.
  • Excellent command of English, both written and spoken.

Nice-to-Have Skills

  • Knowledge of AI-driven operational solutions for predictive monitoring.
  • Background in security practices and compliance for cloud environments.

Together we are

We are Odido, the new provider of mobile, fiber optic and TV. And with almost 2,000 colleagues, we show that telecom can be improved. Because technology is for everyone. Wherever you come from, wherever you go. With Odido everyone participates in the digital world. That is our ambition. Everyone at Odido helps to build a brand that is human, optimistic and progressive.

Is that really something for you? Then we might fit well together.

This is what we stand for

Our name - you can also read it from back to front - consists of different shapes. Which together are one. Because that's how we look at the world around us. As a place where people, no matter how different, move forward together. We're there for each other. We always look at opportunities. We celebrate diversity and are committed to an inclusive work environment with equal opportunities for all. That sounds good of course. But we don't stop at fine words: at Odido we are a recognized Top Employer. A confirmation that we are proud of.

What we offer

  • Good salary and variable bonus scheme;
  • Hybrid working;
  • A progressive pension scheme;
  • 30 vacation days (if you work for us full-time) and an extra day off after Ascension Day;
  • Redeemable holidays;
  • An Odido subscription;
  • Real growth opportunities;
  • Personal annual learning budget and over 200 digital training and courses;
  • Workshops, learning weeks, annual ski trip, fun outings and parties.

You bring this

Some qualities can’t be taught—they’re in your nature. You’re driven by curiosity, calm in chaos, and always two steps ahead when it comes to service reliability. You love solving problems before they happen, and your mindset is one of ownership, accountability, and constant improvement. You understand how tech impacts people—and that’s what keeps you moving.

You combine strategic thinking with hands-on engineering skills, and you know how to bridge conversations between operations, development, and business. Whether it’s designing for scale or jumping in at 3 AM when the pressure’s on, you know what it takes to keep mission-critical services running—because you’ve done it before.

You bring:

  • A HBO or Bachelor’s degree in IT, or equivalent practical experience.
  • 10+ years of experience in Site Reliability Engineering or IT operations, with significant exposure in telecom environments—this is a must.
  • A Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in IT, Telecom, Computer Science, or a related technical field.
  • A deep understanding of telecom services, IT ecosystems, and customer-impacting KPIs.
  • Expertise in service monitoring tools like Netcool, Zabbix, Dynatrace, Splunk, and SolarWinds.
  • A proven track record managing both technical SLAs and business KPIs under pressure.
  • Strong working knowledge of ITIL v3/v4 (certification preferred).
  • Hands-on experience with automation, AIOps, and digital operations platforms.
  • Excellent communication and reporting skills, especially in executive-level interactions and stakeholder engagement.
  • A pragmatic mindset, strong debugging skills, and the confidence to act fast when the stakes are high.

Bonus points if you are certified in one or more of the following:

  • ITIL Foundation/Intermediate/Expert
  • TM Forum Frameworx (eTOM, SID, TAM)
  • PMP / PRINCE2 (Project Management)
  • Cloud certifications (AWS, Azure, GCP)
  • Data/Analytics certifications (a plus, but not required)

Learn every day

At Odido we learn every day. All of us. You are responsible for your own development. That is why you decide how, what and when you learn. We have more than 200 digital training courses with which you can work on professional and personal goals. We don't do old-fashioned performance reviews and assessments. You keep your manager and colleagues informed of your goals and progress. You are in control.

Press on the button

Are you as excited about Odido as we are? Then we are probably a good match. We are looking forward to meet you! You can apply via the application button. Done in a minute!
company_description: Wij zijn Odido. Menselijk, Optimistisch en Vooruitstrevend

title: Data Engineer
description:
In the position of Data Engineer you will play a critical role in designing and maintaining scalable, high-performing data solutions within a dynamic and fast-paced environment.


What you will do

As a Data Engineer you will operate within the Terberg Special Vehicles Aftersales AI product team. The role is responsible for developing, integrating, and maintaining data structures and pipelines that power the AI platform "Mechanic of the Future". The goal is to ensure a robust, scalable, and trustworthy data solution that integrates seamlessly with existing IT systems. You will work closely with a multidisciplinary product team consisting of a product owner, data scientists, and software engineers.

A key responsibility of this role is to actively contribute to Terberg Special Vehicles Aftersales' strategic mission of embedding a digital and AI-driven product development culture. You will work within an agile, multidisciplinary product team and help foster innovation across the broader Terberg organization.


Main tasks and responsibilities:

  • Design and maintain scalable data pipelines for batch and real-time processing
  • Ingest data from various cloud and on-premise sources
  • Apply CI/CD principles, version control, and documentation
  • Ensure secure and reliable data flows aligned with governance standards
  • Continuously improve data infrastructure to support evolving needs
  • Monitor system performance and manage logs
  • Develop pipelines using Azure Data Factory and Databricks
  • Process data with Python, (No)SQL, Gremlin, and (Py)Spark
  • Optimize data flow efficiency and cost
  • Collaborate with the product team to deliver AI solutions
  • Maintain code and documentation using Azure DevOps or GitHub

Who are you and what do you bring?

  • You have a strong foundation in modern data engineering practices, including the development of robust data pipelines, real-time data processing, and the use of cloud-based platforms.
  • Besides that you have experience in managing both structured and unstructured data using a wide range of tools and technologies. A high level of attention to detail is essential, as the reliability and accuracy of data directly impact business operations and decision-making processes.

What do we offer?

As a colleague at Terberg, you will enjoy a great role at one of the most prominent and largest manufacturing companies in the Netherlands. We work from Monday to Friday morning, leaving Friday afternoons free. The atmosphere in our family-owned company is pleasant, and you'll be part of a motivated team. We value your input, and your ideas are always heard. Staying up-to-date in your field is important to us; you'll have access to numerous training and growth opportunities through the Terberg Academy. This position comes with an excellent benefits package and we adhere to the Metal and Technology Collective Labor Agreement (CAO).


Is this your dream job?

Let us know by sending an email with your CV, motivation letter, and optionally your LinkedIn profile to personeel@terbergbenschop.nl. For questions about the role, feel free to call Diederik Stratenus at +31 6 51 49 12 05.


Terberg Special Vehicles is a global leader in the development, production, and service of specialized vehicles. As a family business, we have been committed to our people for over 150 years! Innovation is our strength, and sustainability is our answer. Since 2014, we have been investing in electrically powered vehicles and are actively testing hydrogen solutions. We aim to care for our environment responsibly so that future generations can also enjoy a good life on our planet.


We do not appreciate acquisition efforts in response to this vacancy. Unsolicited submissions of candidates will not be taken into consideration.
company_description: Royal Terberg Group is wereldwijd actief in de ontwikkeling, productie, modificatie en service van speciale voertuigen en systemen voor logistiek en afvalinzameling.

title: Junior Verification and Validation Engineer
description:
We are looking for a Junior Verification and Validation Engineer with a keen interest on learning about and testing our unique Fast Partial Discharge localization technology, and supporting our Energy division. You will become a part of our young and enthusiastic R&D team, working in a dynamic and stimulating international environment, with great growth opportunities. In this role, you will support the design, planning, coordination, execution and reporting activities for the testing of new system components and sensor prototypes as a part of our development process with focus on acoustic characterization of our transducers. Additionally, you’ll be a key supporting team member within our R&D lab, assisting our senior test engineers in ensuring adequate QHSES measures, equipment monitoring and calibration control procedures are adequately implemented.


Optics11 is an Amsterdam-based high-tech scale-up company on a mission to innovate underwater security and put Netherlands on the map of European sonar industry. Our novel fiberoptic technology is redefining underwater security, enabling advanced sonar solutions for safeguarding of key naval and underwater infrastructure. Our high-paced development has been met with an ever growing interest from the market, with selection of our towed array technology for the new generation of Dutch submarines being the latest testament to our progress. As we transition towards commercial deployments, we are seeking ambitious, mission-driven professionals to join us in shaping the next chapter of our growth and success.


Key Responsibilities:

  • Supporting the conceptualization of lab test setups and testing methodologies in accordance with project requirements and the relevant standards.

  • Designing and realization of lab test setups and the associated infrastructure, including mechanical, electrical and software components (in collaboration with our mechanical/electrical/software engineers).

  • Performing the required testing activities according to the developed methodology and planning, with focus on safety, quality and time aspects.

  • Processing and evaluation of measurement data, as well as reporting and documenting the test results for internal and external stakeholders.

  • Maintenance and upgrading of test benches and test equipment in the lab.

  • Interacting and providing feedback to hardware and software R&D engineers supporting development and improvement of our sensors and sensing systems.

  • Documentation and handover of the test setups, corresponding HW/SW infrastructure and evaluation algorithm to our production team.

  • Supporting the Implementation, control and monitoring of sound Health and Safety, and Laboratorial management processes within our R&D Lab.

What’s in it for you?

  • Competitive salary and benefits package.

  • A key project role in a high-tech scale-up with real impact.

  • A dynamic international environment with short decision lines and plenty of room to grow.

  • A fun and collaborative team culture where innovation and initiative are valued.


Qualifications:

  • MSc (or higher) in Mechanical/Electrical/Mechatronics engineering, experimental physics or similar.

  • Experience in acoustic and/or vibrational testing in research and development context.

  • Experience with interfacing, controlling and automation of lab and measurement equipment.

  • Excellent knowledge and experience with data acquisition, signal conditioning and processing.

  • Experience with Python, MATLAB, or LabView.

  • Good communication skills in English.

  • Structured and independent way of working.

  • Experience with fibreoptic measurement principles and/or interferometry is a plus.

More information:

So now you know we're doing awesome projects and if you see you fit the profile, we would like to get to know you. Apply and drop your details or, in case of questions, get in touch with our recruiter Dora Öveges via dora.oveges@optics11.com.

title: Software Engineer
description:
About Source.ag: The Mission

At Source, we are on a mission to empower the world's growers with AI to sustainably feed a growing global population. The world’s leading growers use our SaaS products to optimize their operations, improve yields, and increase resource efficiency. We don't just sell software; we build deep partnerships with our customers to solve some of the most fundamental challenges in the global food supply chain.

This is not a typical software problem. We are modeling the complex, biological reality of a high-tech greenhouse and translating it into actionable intelligence. If you are excited by the challenge of using technology to solve real-world problems at a global scale, this is the place for you.

The Opportunity: What You'll Do

As a Software Engineer at Source, you will be a core contributor to the systems that power our AI-driven platform. You won't just be closing tickets; you will be building and scaling the infrastructure that turns complex data into critical decisions for our growers.

At our core, we are a data-intensive systems company solving real-world agricultural challenges. Our main technical challenge is to model the complex biological and operational reality of a high-tech greenhouse. This involves building robust systems to process diverse data streams—from IoT sensors to user-input from our iPad apps—and turning that data into actionable intelligence. You will be instrumental in designing, building, and scaling these critical systems.

In this role, you will:

  • Design, build, and maintain scalable microservices primarily in Golang, with opportunities to work in Python on our ML/data-centric services.

  • Work with a modern, diverse data stack, including PostgreSQL, TimescaleDB, MongoDB, and our core analytics platform on Databricks.

  • Build robust, high-performance APIs using gRPC for internal communication and contribute to our GraphQL backend for frontend that serves our frontend.

  • Own your services from idea to production and beyond. You will write code, build tests, and deploy your services using our GitOps pipeline on AWS (ECS & Lambda).

  • Contribute to our architectural evolution. You will be a key voice in discussions around service boundaries, communication patterns, and best practices.

  • Collaborate across the stack. While your focus will be on the backend, you'll have opportunities to contribute to our frontend (React/Typescript) to help ship features end-to-end.

We believe you'll be successful if you:

  • Have a "Problem-First" Mindset: When faced with a request, your first instinct is to ask, "What is the underlying problem we are trying to solve?" You are driven to find the most efficient solution to the root cause.

  • Take High Ownership: You feel a deep sense of accountability for your work. You see projects through to completion and are proactive about identifying and fixing issues.

  • Are a Pragmatic Builder: You have a bias for action and know how to find the 80/20 solution to deliver value quickly without sacrificing quality. You have a strong sense of what it takes to build and operate real-world systems.

  • Think in Systems: You don't just see your service; you see how it fits into the broader architecture. You can reason about dependencies, data flows, and the impact of your changes.

  • Communicate with Clarity: You can articulate complex technical ideas simply and directly, both in writing (docs, code comments) and in person.

Our Way of Working

We are a high-performance team on a mission to solve a massive global challenge. This means we move fast, embrace change, and are constantly learning. Our environment is for builders who thrive on autonomy and are energized by seeing their work create a direct impact. We value velocity and pragmatism over bureaucracy. If you are driven by learning, taking ownership, and want to be part of a team where your contributions truly matter, you will find a home here.

AI at Source: How We Build

AI is core to how we operate and what we build. We equip our engineers with the best tools available, like Cursor and OpenAI Codex, to accelerate development. If you are excited by the opportunity to apply modern AI and LLMs to a unique, real-world dataset to solve complex problems, you will be right at home here.

If you are a builder who wants to make a tangible impact on a global scale and are excited by the challenge of solving hard problems, we would love to hear from you.


Your Experience:

  • Proven relevant work experience in building, deploying, and operating backend services in a production environment (typically 4+ years).

  • Strong proficiency in Golang and/or Python.

  • Hands-on experience with Docker and a deep appreciation for clean, reproducible development environments.

  • Experience with relational databases (like PostgreSQL) and an understanding of how to model data effectively.

  • Familiarity with cloud platforms, preferably AWS.

  • Preferred start date September 1 or earlier

Our Tech Stack:

  • Backend: Golang, Python

  • Frontend: Typescript, React, Next.js

  • Communication: gRPC, GraphQL, REST, AWS EventBridge/SNS/SQS

  • Data: Databricks, Delta Lake, S3, PostgreSQL (RDS), TimescaleDB, MongoDB Atlas

  • Infrastructure: AWS (ECS, Lambda), Docker, Vercel

  • Monitoring: Datadog

Our offer in return for your talent and skills

  • A hybrid work environment - we have working days at the office on Mondays and Thursdays

  • Paid lunch

  • Pension contribution of 4.5%

  • Mental well-being guidance through OpenUp

  • Macbook Pro 16”

  • Travel allowance for office commute

  • Annual learning budget of € 1,000

  • Work from home budget of € 550

  • Monthly wifi & phone plan reimbursement of €50

  • Unlimited holidays and we expect you at least to take 25 per year

  • Each quarter we have a big company event that includes dinner and special activities

At Source, we highly value diversity of backgrounds and thoughts. Research has shown that people make different internal assessments of whether they are a good fit for the job. We therefore highly encourage you to apply for this job, even if you feel you might not 'tick all the boxes!
company_description: At Source we believe A.I.-powered indoor farms are an answer to safer, more reliable, and climate-resilient food production. Innovation in the way we grow our fruit and vegetables is swiftly needed to

title: Software Engineer, C++
description:
Flow Traders is looking for experienced C++ Software Engineers to join our growing team in Amsterdam. The ideal candidate is curious, methodical and a multitasker. This is a unique opportunity to join a leading proprietary trading firm with an entrepreneurial and innovative culture at the heart of its business. We value quick-witted, creative minds and challenge them to make full use of their capacities.

At Flow Traders you will develop low-latency systems for trading various asset classes across global venues. Working closely with product owners, traders, and quantitative analysts, you'll design and optimize trading strategies. You'll focus on platform support, latency reduction, fault tolerance, and memory optimization, ensuring high throughput. Your role includes deployment, post-deployment support, and collaboration with operations and trading teams to maintain infrastructure stability, performance, and availability, while also addressing production issues and enhancing monitoring.


Some of the technologies we use in the development process:

We do not expect previous experience with all the items listed below.

  • C++ (Standard in use: C++17. Migrating to C++20)
  • Compilers: gcc 10 / clang 17
  • Python, Rust and Typescript
  • Build system: CMake
  • Version control: Git
  • Testing frameworks: Google Test, Pytest, and Nosetest
  • Version control/code review system: Bitbucket
  • Operating system: Debian Linux
  • Continuous integration system: Bamboo
  • Deployment automation: Ansible

What you will do:

Main technical activities include:

For all C++ openings:

  • Lead the development and global rollout of our Core platform used in multiple business/focus groups (Market data, Quantitative research, Pricing, Strategies)
  • Be involved in the development process, which will be a fast-paced iterative process where you deploy your deliverables and validate them yourself and/or together with traders or quants
  • Develop tools/frameworks to deliver capabilities for tuning/develop data-driven systematic pricing and trading strategies
  • Work together with focus group engineers, Quants and Technical traders to refine requirements, collect feedback, and iterate on design and implementation of platform requirements

Exchange Connectivity:

  • Write software that communicates with crypto exchanges through their APIs, receiving market data and sending orders over the network in different protocols, such as FIX, Websocket or HTTP requests
  • Ensure quality of software based on a set of testing suites, which you are expected to use, maintain and extend
  • Optimize exchange communication through kernel bypass, optimizing TLS or the connection handling to an exchange
  • Research exchange behavior in detail to align our behavior to that of an exchange
  • Implement these solutions using the provided exchange SDKs in different languages such as C++, Rust, Python, Typescript

Trading Strategies:

  • Implement trading algorithms based on requirements provided by traders and quants
  • Acquire and develop the necessary trading knowledge to successfully translate the requirements into actual software implementation
  • Continuously improve the stability, reliability, and performance of the trading engine
  • Enhance monitoring and observability in collaboration with the Trading Operations team
  • Investigate and resolve production issues such as crashes, unexpected business logic behavior, and performance bottlenecks
  • Prepare for releases and deployments of new trading engine versions

What you need to succeed:

  • 5+ years of experience with C++
  • Good knowledge of data structures and algorithms
  • Cryptocurrency/Blockchain familiarity highly preferable
  • Understanding of full software development life cycle
  • Ability to write clean and simple code
  • Relevant experience with unit and regression testing
  • Knowledgeable about computer architecture and memory subsystem
  • Experience with some Linux distribution
  • Good interpersonal and team playing skills
  • Ability to communicate with stakeholders with different backgrounds

Flow Traders does not accept unsolicited resumes from any professional staffing or search firms. All resumes, and any other information identifying potential candidates, submitted to any employee at Flow Traders via-email, the Internet or directly without a valid and signed search agreement will be deemed free to contact by Flow Traders without any restrictions and no placement fee of any kind will be paid in the event the candidate is hired by Flow Traders.
company_description: Flow Traders is a leading global financial technology-enabled liquidity provider, historically specialized in Exchange Traded Products (ETPs), now expanding into other asset classes.

title: Lead Software Engineer
description:
• Amsterdam
  • Full-time

About us

With millions of daily transactions and clients worldwide, Advidi faces various technical challenges. Our tech team collaborates with all business units at Advidi, maintaining an extensive portfolio of diverse products. These include high availability, high-load and globally distributed tracking solutions, custom portals for clients, internal dashboards, and automation for internal processes.


In the next few years, our team will focus on building a new platform to replace many of our existing products. Work on this platform is just beginning, so nothing is set in stone yet. You'll have the opportunity to significantly influence this product's development throughout its lifetime.

Join us as a Lead Software Engineer and play a crucial role in expanding this landscape. You'll enjoy a great deal of freedom and the responsibility that comes with working in an innovative setting. We expect you to take ownership of the products, technical architecture, product maintenance, and project delivery. We believe in leaders and managers who are both contributors and help the people who report to you grow. You will report directly to the CTO and manage a team of about 4 developers.

Technology Stack

  • Spring Boot with Kotlin

  • Python

  • A wide variety of technologies from Amazon Web Services

  • Terraform and AWS CDK

  • Frontend in Angular 16+

Responsibilities:

  • You are responsible for one of the two development teams

  • Manage your 4 direct reports, mentor them and help them grow

  • Align with business and product stakeholders

  • Contribute to the code base, architecture and planning

  • Maintain an existing portfolio of products

Required skills:



  • Bachelor/Master Degree in Computer Science or a related field.

  • 7+ years of relevant work experience post-graduation.

  • At least one year in a lead or engineering manager role.

  • Solid experience using Python or a JVM language like Kotlin or Java.

  • Experienced using cloud computing, preferably in combination with IAC.

  • Ability to write clean, reliable, and highly scalable code.

  • Comfortable communicating with business stakeholders and gathering requirements.

  • Experienced with large-scale projects.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Experience with Typescript

  • Experience using the Spring Framework.

  • Strong knowledge of SQL and query performance.

  • Familiarity with AWS.

What we offer?

  • A competitive salary

  • Proper guidance and support from fellow senior developers if and when you need it

  • Time to learn in a way you see fit

  • A monthly budget of €30 on YourCampus App (wide range of benefits, ranging from gym memberships to vouchers for your favourite webshops/ services)

  • 25 holiday days + 1 free day off during your birthday week

  • Option to buy 10 more days off

  • Fun events such as Game Night, Fancy Friday, seasonal parties and more

  • Daily fresh lunches and snacks prepared by our Chef

  • Gym membership discount and the possibility to work out during office hours

  • Table tennis, football, darts, football field, basketball court

  • Company-sponsored Dutch lessons

Further information

Agency applications regarding this vacancy will not be reviewed.

Please note: We do not review applications sent via email.

Please note: We only accept applicants residing in Europe.

Interested?

Patrycja Jasińska

patrycja.jasinska@advidi.com


Additional Information

  • About Advidi

    Advidi is an Affiliate Network that unifies the smartest players in the affiliate marketing business. We help affiliates and advertisers around the world to successfully trade media at scale with unparalleled levels of support, control, and transparency. Affiliate marketing is a specific type of performance marketing, and our network effectively acts as the middleman; our support help all parties improve results.

  • Our company culture

    We work hard and we play hard, but we keep a careful eye on balance. A focus on personal development and sharing ideas defines our collaborative culture. Health and wellbeing always take precedence over profits. We’re a team. We share our successes and setbacks with each other. Everyone is encouraged to contribute. We follow up on this with yearly company trips, trimester outings, open company meetings and a sense of togetherness weaved into everything we do.

title: Cloud Platform Engineer
description:
Met jouw energie kan het

Enexis speelt een cruciale rol in de Energietransitie. We leveren niet meer alleen energie; opwekkers van bijvoorbeeld zonne-energie leveren ook aan ons terug. Om ons energienet beheersbaar en betrouwbaar te houden maken we steeds meer gebruik van innovatieve IT-oplossingen. Als DevOps engineer zorg jij er samen met je collega's in Den Bosch en Weert voor dat die oplossingen makkelijk en veilig kunnen landen op ons stabiele multi-cloud platform. Daarnaast zorgt het team ervoor dat een breed pallet aan standaard tools voor code management, CI/CD, monitoring, logging, enz. voor meer dan 100 Agile teams ter beschikking staat.

Niet alleen de complexiteit van ons energienetwerk maakt jouw job uitdagend. IT is een steeds groter onderdeel van de core business van Enexis. In de dynamische wereld van netwerkbeheerders en energiebedrijven lopen we voorop met onze cloudkeuzes. Onze cloudoplossingen en ondersteunende toolsets zijn state of the art. Vaak zijn we de eerste die een nieuwe techniek gebruikt. Je krijgt met het team de ruimte om innovaties aan te dragen en zelf tot uitvoering te brengen.

De maatschappelijke ontwikkelingen op energiegebied gaan de komende jaren in alle hevigheid door. Dat betekent dat onze cloudplatforms en platformdiensten nooit af zullen zijn. Er staat je dus een toekomst met veel mooie uitdagingen te wachten.

Zo ga jij deze uitdaging aan
Jij draagt zorg voor de vernieuwing, verbetering en het beheer van het Enexis ‘Cloud Native Architecture Platform' (ofwel: het Enexis CNAP). Met de tooling en automatisering die je ontwikkelt in het DevOps-team, maak je het werk van de honderden IT'ers binnen Enexis mogelijk. ‘Everything as Code' en ‘NoOps' zijn jouw mantra's en met jouw software development skills til je de oplossingen van ons team naar een nog hoger niveau. En omdat jij de inhoudelijke specialist bent, geef je gevraagd en ongevraagd advies en deel je actief jouw kennis binnen de IT-organisatie. Je bent er trots op als een ander team succesvol is door gebruik te maken van jouw platform en platformdiensten !


Functiebeschrijving


Zo ga jij deze uitdaging aan

Als Cloud Platform Engineer bij Enexis draag je zorg voor de vernieuwing, verbetering en het beheer van ons ‘Cloud Native Architecture Platform' (CNAP). Met jouw tooling en automatisering maak je het werk van honderden IT'ers binnen Enexis mogelijk. Je deelt actief jouw kennis en geeft advies binnen de IT-organisatie.

Jouw verantwoordelijkheid zijn:

  • Vernieuwing en verbetering: Zorg voor de vernieuwing, verbetering en het beheer van het Enexis CNAP.
  • Tooling en automatisering: Ontwikkel tooling en automatisering binnen het DevOps-team om het werk van honderden IT'ers mogelijk te maken.
  • Advies en kennisdeling: Geef gevraagd en ongevraagd advies en deel actief jouw kennis binnen de IT-organisatie.
  • Succes van andere teams: Wees trots als andere teams succesvol zijn door gebruik te maken van jouw platform en platformdiensten.
  • Software development skills: Til de oplossingen van ons team naar een hoger niveau met jouw software development skills en de mantra's ‘Everything as Code' en ‘NoOps'.

Functie-eisen


Zo pak jij het aan
Nieuwsgierig naar nieuwe technologieën en technieken én een tikkeltje eigenwijs. Een omschrijving waarin jij je meteen herkent. Je bent geen specialist op één onderdeel van cloudengineering, maar weet gewoon veel van het hele vakgebied. En je wil echt niet uit je bed worden gebeld voor een storing, dus het via code wegautomatiseren van werk en creëren van stabiliteit en veiligheid zit in je DNA.

Je bent leergierig en hebt het vermogen om complexe zaken inzichtelijk te maken en je nieuwe skills snel eigen te maken. En met je goede communicatieve vaardigheden weet je anderen te overtuigen van de kracht van vernieuwing.

Dit breng je ook mee:

  • Een HBO-diploma of HBO-niveau door relevante werkervaring.
  • Minimaal drie jaar ervaring met cloudplatforms als AWS en Azure
  • Minimaal drie jaar Software Development ervaring om handmatig werk te automatiseren (wij gebruiken Python).
  • Kennis van Kubernetes en cloud-native architectuur, zoals containers en serverless
  • Een ‘alles-als-code' mentaliteit, bij voorkeur met kennis van Git, GitOps, Terraform en Ansible.
    • Wij zijn een tweetalig team, dus beheersing van het Nederlands en Engels.


Arbeidsvoorwaarden


En wij steken natuurlijk ook energie in jou
Bij Enexis werk je in de voorhoede van een van de grootste uitdagingen van onze tijd: de energietransitie. Daarbij zorgen we goed voor je. Dat begint met een uitgebreid welkomstpakket en -programma om je collega's te leren kennen. En met goede arbeidsvoorwaarden:

  • Salaris tussen € 4.059,- en € 5.799, - bruto per maand (op basis van 40 uur per week). Inclusief secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden kan je salaris oplopen tot € 7.801, - bruto per maand.
  • Bijdrage van 70% aan je ABP Keuzepensioen.
  • Persoonlijk budget van 10% en een 13e maand van 10,7% van je brutojaarsalaris. Deze kun je flexibel inzetten of maandelijks of jaarlijks laten uitbetalen.
  • 24,5 vakantiedagen bij een fulltime dienstverband. Meer oplaadtijd nodig? Met je persoonlijk budget en 13e maand koop je tot wel 35,5 extra verlofdagen.
  • Mogelijkheden om thuis te werken, inclusief een door ons ingerichte thuiswerkplek en een vergoeding van € 2,40 per thuiswerkdag.
  • Laptop of tablet en telefoon.
  • Reiskostenvergoeding en een eersteklas ov-abonnement voor zakelijk gebruik.
  • Vitaliteitsbudget van € 500,- voor bijvoorbeeld een sportabonnement.
  • Ruimte om te groeien met ons interne ontwikkelplatform of externe opleidingen en trainingen.

Lees meer over onze arbeidsvoorwaarden.


Werk als Cloud Software Engineer aan het energienetwerk van morgen
Solliciteer via de button onder aan deze pagina. Binnen twee weken ontvang je een reactie. Heb je vragen over de functie? Neem dan contact op met Mirja den Reijer, Corporate Recruiter IT, via mirja.den.reijer@enexis.nl of 06 – 21508667.


Goed om te weten

  • Na je sollicitatie ontvang je een e-mail met meer informatie over de procedure. Meestal bestaat deze uit twee gesprekken: een eerste (online) gesprek met de manager en recruiter en een tweede gesprek met je toekomstige collega's op locatie.
  • Een screening is onderdeel van de sollicitatieprocedure. Deze kan bestaan uit een assessment, het opvragen van referenties en een Verklaring Omtrent het Gedrag (VOG). Hierover ontvang je meer informatie tijdens de procedure.
company_description: Enexis Groep biedt iedereen altijd toegang tot energie. Dat is wat ons drijft. Duurzame verbindingen leggen, comfort bieden, blijven leren en groeien, het beste geven en dat alles vanuit vakmanschap.

title: Senior Data Engineer
description:
This is Adyen

Adyen provides payments, data, and financial products in a single solution for customers like Meta, Uber, H&M, and Microsoft - making us the financial technology platform of choice. At Adyen, everything we do is engineered for ambition.

For our teams, we create an environment with opportunities for our people to succeed, backed by the culture and support to ensure they are enabled to truly own their careers. We are motivated individuals who tackle unique technical challenges at scale and solve them as a team. Together, we deliver innovative and ethical solutions that help businesses achieve their ambitions faster.

Senior Data Engineer

At Adyen, we treat data and data artifacts as first-class citizens. They form our backbone and drive the business and product insights we generate. To this end, Adyen is looking for a Senior Data Engineers in Amsterdam. We're looking for engineers that understand the business context and the data needs behind it, and excel in implementing high-quality data pipelines on our Big Data Platform. As a Senior Data Engineer at Adyen, you will play a crucial role in shaping our data infrastructure and ensuring the seamless flow of data across various systems.

What you'll do

  • Collaborative Solution Development: Engage with a diverse range of stakeholders, including data scientists, analysts, software engineers, product managers, and customers, to understand their requirements and craft effective solutions.
  • State-of-the-Art Pipelines and Architecture: Design, develop, deploy and operate high-quality production ELT pipelines and data architectures. Integrate data from various sources and formats, ensuring compatibility, consistency, and reliability. Design scalable architectures.
  • Champion Data Best Practices: Proactively establish and advocate for best practices in performance, code quality, data validation, data governance, and discoverability across Adyen through mentoring, training, and knowledge sharing.
  • High Quality Data and Code: Ensure data is accurate, complete, reliable, relevant, and timely. Implement rigorous testing, monitoring and validation protocols for your code and data, leveraging tools such as Pytest.
  • Performance Optimization: Identify and resolve performance bottlenecks in data pipelines and systems. Optimize query performance and resource utilization to meet SLAs and performance requirements, using technologies such as caching, indexing, partitioning, and other Spark optimizations.

Who you are

  • Experienced in Big Data: Over 7 years of experience working as a Data Engineer or in a similar role.
  • Data & Engineering practices: You possess an expert-level understanding of both Software and Data Engineering practices.
  • Technical Super Star: Highly proficient in tools and languages such as: Python, PySpark, Airflow, Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, SQL, Git.
  • Clear Communicator: Skilled at articulating complex data-related concepts and outcomes to a diverse range of stakeholders.
  • Self-starter: Capable of independently recognizing opportunities, devising solutions, leading, prioritizing and owning projects.
  • Innovator: You have an experimental mindset with a 'launch fast and iterate' mentality.
  • Data Culture Champion: Experienced in fostering a data-centric culture within large, technical organizations and setting standards for excellence and continuous improvement.

Data positions at Adyen

We know companies handle different definitions for their data-related positions, this is for instance dependent on the size of a company. Since the birth of the Data Solution and the growth of all data streams, we categorized and defined all our positions. Have a look at this blogpost to find out!

Our Diversity, Equity and Inclusion commitments

Our unique approach is a product of our diverse perspectives. This diversity of backgrounds and cultures is essential in helping us maintain our momentum. Our business and technical challenges are unique, and we need as many different voices as possible to join us in solving them - voices like yours. No matter who you are or where you're from, we welcome you to be your true self at Adyen.

Studies show that women and members of underrepresented communities apply for jobs only if they meet 100% of the qualifications. Does this sound like you? If so, Adyen encourages you to reconsider and apply. We look forward to your application!

What's next?

Ensuring a smooth and enjoyable candidate experience is critical for us. We aim to get back to you regarding your application within 5 business days. Our interview process tends to take about 4 weeks to complete, but may fluctuate depending on the role. Learn more about our hiring process here. Don't be afraid to let us know if you need more flexibility.

This role is based out of our Amsterdam office. We are an office-first company and value in-person collaboration; we do not offer remote-only roles.
company_description: The Only Payment Solution You'll Ever Need | Wherever People Pay

title: Data Scientist / Business Intel Engineer, EU Prime and Marketing Analytics & Science (PRIMAS)
description:
- Experience using SQL to pull data from a database or data warehouse and scripting experience (Python) to process data for modeling - Experience with forecasting and statistical analysis - Experience with data modeling, warehousing and building ETL pipelines - Experience with data visualization using Tableau, Quicksight, or similar tools - Experience in Statistical Analysis packages such as R, SAS and Matlab - Experience with SQL - Experience developing and presenting recommendations of new metrics allowing better understanding of the performance of the business - Experience writing complex SQL queries - Master's degree in BI, finance, engineering, statistics, computer science, mathematics, finance or equivalent quantitative field
Are you passionate about giving customers the richest, most inspiring experience in their shopping journey? Do you like to dive deep to understand how customer-centric solutions drive measurable results? Do you enjoy working closely with the business, scientists and software engineers to build scalable products? You are in the right place! Come join our Prime & Marketing Analytics and Science (PRIMAS) team, where your actions will have direct impact to millions of customers! The EU Marketing & Prime organization is looking for a Business Intelligence Engineer. The position can be based in Amsterdam/London/Luxembourg/Barcelona. The PRIMAS team provides a comprehensive understanding of customer segments, affinities and lifetime value. We use the latest data science tools and advanced analytical techniques to study customer purchase and engagement behaviors and generate actionable insights on where, when and how we provide products and programs to our customers to meet their needs and to delight them. We help to increase customer engagement, sales and marketing efficiency. Our systems are built entirely in-house and on automated large-scale analytics systems. You will generate insights, design/deliver/measure experiments and strategies across marketing channels (SEM/SEO, Affiliates, Display, Social, Mobile, Email, Onsite, etc.), engagement products and customer segments. You will improve our understanding of Customer behavior and engagement, design and conduct rigorous experiments on the effectiveness and efficiency of different marketing actions that will inform long term strategy. You will have the opportunity to work on the forefront of consumer analytics tackling some of the most difficult problems in the industry with some of the best scientists, statisticians and software engineers in the field. Key job responsibilities You are good at: • Working on complex loosely defined analytics problems and defining the team's Business Intelligence (BI) strategy. Delivering independently, and influencing the organization's BI architecture • Providing analytics solutions for complex business problems. Building analyses/solutions that are robust, extensible and scalable. Communicating effectively with management audiences (e.g., narratives, inputs into Business Reviews). Refining Business Intelligence strategies that cross teams and making technical trade-offs for long term/short-term needs. • Designing and implementing technical solutions with an appropriate analytics strategy and data set design. Understanding system limitations, scaling factors, boundary conditions, and/or the reasons for technical decisions • Providing analyses, frameworks and solutions that inform multiple teams' business decisions and highlight new opportunities • Driving best practices in operational excellence, data modelling, and analysis
  • Experience in data mining, ETL, etc. and using databases in a business environment with large-scale, complex datasets
  • Experience in analyzing and interpreting data with Redshift, Oracle, NoSQL etc.
  • Experience with AWS solutions such as EC2, DynamoDB, S3, and Redshift

Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.

Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.
company_addresses: 440 Terry Ave N, Seattle, WA, United States, Washington

title: Senior Data Scientist / Python Developer, Order Allocation, Group Digital, Ingka Group
description:
• Job ID: 297425

  • Date posted: 01/07/2025

    • Who you are

    We are looking for a highly motivated Data Scientist / Python Developer to join our Order Allocation team and play a key role in shaping the logistics of fulfilling customer orders at IKEA. We want a team player who likes combining technical expertise with business curiosity. Do you have a strong math and programming background? Do you enjoy developing algorithms to improve business decisions? Then this is a great opportunity for you!

    Do you recognise yourself in some of the following:
    • Master’s or Ph.D. degree in Mathematics, Operations Research, Computer Science, or a related quantitative field.
    • Strong background in Python development: clean and modular code design, test-driven development, CI/CD, logging and monitoring, etc.
    • Expertise in code performance and algorithm design for optimisation and analysis models (e.g., operations research implementations).
    • Proactive attitude and critical thinking in understanding business needs and proposing pragmatic solutions
    • Team spirit and ability to work in cross-functional teams with product owners, data scientists, data analysts, and software engineers

    • This is our wish list! If you don’t recognise yourself in all these points, you might still be an excellent candidate for the role. We like to think long-term and invest in people’s development together with us.

    The IKEA culture and values are very much a part of our business and day-to-day work life. For you to thrive and grow with IKEA, it’s important for us that you share our values! You can read more about our values and life at IKEA on our website www.ikea.com.

    Your responsibilities

    You will leverage your technical and analytical skills together with the team in the development of digital products within order allocation. This will require:

    • Designing, implementing, and refining analysis and optimisation algorithms to improve order allocation and fulfillment efficiency.
    • Developing and deploying high-quality Python solutions that integrate with our tech infrastructure.
    • Continuously improving algorithms and discussing solution alternatives in cross-functional teams.
    • Studying fulfilment processes and understanding the optimisation and analysis problems therein

    • Our team within IKEA

    You will work in the Order Allocation team, in the Fulfilment and Core Services domain. The team is cross-functional and consists of other data scientists, data analysts, software engineers, and product owners. Together, the team builds digital products that orchestrate how and when customer orders are fulfilled, balancing various trade-offs and optimising different objectives. In addition to developing software, the team provides insights to business partners on product configurations and logistic process improvements at a global scale, in countries where IKEA is present.

    We can offer you:
    • Opportunities to work on business problems that have a global impact on both IKEA’s customers and operations
    • A team of great colleagues to learn with and from (with world-class experience across all aspects of Data & Analytics and Software Engineering)
    • Flexible and modern tools: we deploy mainly on Google Cloud Platform, and we use a lot of open-source tools across the board.
    • Continuous learning (we aim to spend 20% of our working time on learning).
    • Flexible and friendly working environment.

    • Questions and support? Let's connect!

    The role is based in Amsterdam, Netherlands, and you will report to Data & Machine Learning Team Leader.

    As you might know, in Sweden it’s common to take a few weeks of holiday during July, most people take over multiple weeks in a row; at IKEA, we are no different. We believe in a healthy work-life balance and encourage our co-workers to take time to relax, recharge, and unwind. Because of this great benefit, the recruitment process might take a bit longer.

    In this recruitment, there is no relocation support provided by Ingka, hence, we are looking for people already living in or within commuting distance of the mentioned location.

    We look forward to learning more about you!
company_description: At IKEA, we share an inspiring vision: “to create a better everyday life for the many people”.

title: Chief Architect Data & Analytics
description:
• REQ-10098465
  • 02/07/2025
  • IT Architecture
  • Amsterdam, Nederland
  • 2.496,00 - 3.114,31 per month
  • ING Bank


We are seeking a highly eperienced Chief Data & Analytics and Information Architect to lead the strategic design and implementation of our global bank’s data and information architecture. This role is critical in shaping the future of our data ecosystem, ensuring seamless integration across business units, and leveraging advanced analytics, AI, and cloud technologies to drive innovation and efficiency. As a key leader, you will collaborate with senior stakeholders, technology teams, and data scientists to define and implement best-in-class data solutions that align with our business objectives and regulatory requirements.

The team

As Chief Data & Analytics and Information Architect, you will have 11 direct reports. You report hierarchically to the CIO Data & Analytics and have a functional reporting line to the Global Head of Tech Strategy & Enterprise Architecture. Together with all Chief Architects globally, you are also part of the Management Team Enterprise Architects.

Key Responsibilities

The Chief Architect Data & Analytics is responsible for:

Strategic Leadership: Define and e
  • ecute the enterprise-wide data and information architecture strategy, ensuring alignment with business goals and regulatory frameworks.
  • Architecture Design: Develop scalable, secure, and high-performance data and information architectures, incorporating cloud platforms, big data technologies, and AI/ML capabilities.
  • Information Management: Design and maintain an information architecture that supports optimal data flow, storage, and integration across various systems and applications.
  • Data Governance: Develop and oversee data governance policies and procedures to ensure data accuracy, accessibility, and security across the organization.
  • Technology Roadmap: Evaluate emerging data and information technologies, tools, and platforms, driving innovation and continuous improvement in analytics and information management capabilities.
  • Collaboration & Stakeholder Management: Partner with business leaders, technology teams, data scientists and vendors to translate business needs into architectural solutions that are scalable, sustainable and adaptable to changing business demands.
  • Cloud & Infrastructure Optimization: Lead the migration and modernization of data and information platforms on cloud and hybrid environments.
  • AI & Advanced Analytics: Enable data-driven decision-making by designing architectures that support AI/ML models, real-time analytics, and predictive insights.
  • Security & Risk Management: Ensure data and information security, risk mitigation, and resilience across all platforms and pipelines. Establish and enforce data governance frameworks, ensuring adherence to global banking regulations and data privacy laws (e.g., GDPR, BCBS 239).
    • Talent Development: Mentor and guide engineering and architecture teams, fostering a culture of innovation and technical e
  • cellence.
  • Enterprise Architecture Alignment: Collaborate with enterprise architects, data engineers, and other stakeholders to ensure the alignment of information architecture with enterprise architecture and business objectives.
  • Innovation & Research: Stay informed about industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices to guide the continuous improvement of the enterprise data and information architecture.

How to succeed

Eperience:

8+ years of e
  • perience in data architecture, information architecture, or related fields, with at least 5 years in a senior leadership role within a global financial institution.
    • E
  • perience in leading large-scale data transformations and cloud migrations.

Technical Epertise:

Data & Information Architecture: E
  • pertise in designing scalable data and information architectures, including data lakes, warehouses, and real-time analytics platforms.
  • Cloud Platforms: Proficiency with (preferably) Google Cloud, Azure, and AWS for data and information solutions.
    • Big Data & Analytics: E
  • perience with technologies such as Iceberg, Spark, Snowflake, Databricks, and Kafka.
  • Deep understanding of agentic AI systems including autonomous agents, multi-agent systems, and AI-driven orchestration frameworks.
  • Database Management: Strong understanding of SQL and NoSQL databases (e.g., PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Cassandra).
  • ETL & Data Integration: Knowledge of tools like Apache NiFi, Informatica, or Fivetran.
  • AI & Machine Learning: Deep understanding of Gen AI & Machine Learning, both in terms of technology and impact - Understanding of ML models, AI-driven analytics, and MLOps frameworks.
    • Enterprise Architecture Frameworks: E
  • tensive knowledge of frameworks (e.g., TOGAF, Zachman), tools (Archimate) and methodologies.
  • Data Governance Tools: Familiarity with tools and technologies (e.g., Collibra, Informatica, Talend).

Competencies and Skills:

Leadership: Strong leadership, communication, and stakeholder management skills with the ability to influence at all levels of the organization. E
  • perience in leading cross-functional teams and mentoring technical talent.
    • Problem-Solving: Eceptional analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to navigate comple
  • technical challenges.
  • Strategic Vision: Strong understanding of how data and information architecture supports business strategy and capable of developing long-term, scalable solutions that align with evolving technology trends and business demands.
    • Collaboration & Teamwork: Effective at working with diverse teams, including business units, e
  • ternal vendors, and senior leadership, and skilled in facilitating productive discussions and managing conflicting priorities.
    • Communication & Presentation: Ecellent communication skills, capable of conveying comple technical concepts to non-technical audiences, and strong writing and presentation skills for e
  • ecutive and board-level reports.
    • Analytical Thinking: Ability to analyze comple
  • systems and data environments to derive strategic insights and architecture solutions, and skilled in translating business needs into technical specifications.
    • Risk Management: E
  • pertise in identifying potential risks related to information security, data privacy, and system integration, with a proactive approach to mitigating those risks.
    • Change Management: Eperience in managing organizational change, especially in the conte
  • t of digital transformation and new technology implementations, and the ability to guide teams through the transition while maintaining productivity.
    • Innovation & Creativity: Ability to innovate within the enterprise architecture landscape, finding creative solutions to meet comple business and technical challenges, and willingness to e
  • plore new technologies and methods to enhance data architectures.

Rewards & benefits

We want to make sure that it’s possible for you to strike the right balance between your career and your private life. You can find out more about our employment conditions at https://www.ing.jobs/netherlands/Why-ING/benefits.htm

The benefits of working with us at ING include:

A salary tailored to your qualities and e
  • perience
  • 24-27 vacation days depending on contract
  • Pension scheme
  • 13th month salary
  • Individual Savings Contribution (BIS), 3.5% of your gross annual salary
  • 8% Holiday payment
  • Personal growth and challenging work with endless possibilities
  • An informal working environment with innovative colleagues
  • Work Agile, so new ideas come to life faster

About us

With 60,000 employees and operations in approimately 40 countries, there is no shortage of opportunities for people with initiative who want to help people take a step ahead in life and in business. Do you want to work at the cutting edge of what’s possible and at the same time ensure you work with integrity and hold the customer’s interests at heart? Do you want to be surrounded by progressive, inspiring, diverse and supportive colleagues? Then there is no better place to invest your talents than at ING. Join us. Apply today.


Your place of work
Eplore the area

Questions? Just ask
Orhan Sari


Bij ING willen we het beste uit mensen halen. Daarom hebben we een inclusieve cultuur waarin iedereen de kans krijgt om te groeien en een verschil te maken voor onze klanten en de samenleving. Diversiteit, gelijkheid en inclusie staan bij ons altijd voorop. We behan iedereen eerlijk, ongeacht leeftijd, geslacht, genderidentiteit, culturele achtergrond, ervaring, geloof, ras, etniciteit, beperking, gezinssituatie, seksuele geaardheid, sociale afkomst of wat dan ook. Heb je hulp nodig of kunnen we iets voor je doen tijdens je sollicitatie of gesprek? Neem dan contact op met de recruiter die bij de vacature vermeld staat. We werken graag samen met jou om het proces eerlijk en toegankelijk te maken. Lees hier meer over hoe wij staan voor diversiteit, inclusie en erbij horen.

title: Medior Analytics Translator Transaction Monitoring – Model Operations & Delivery
description:
This is what we offer you

  • Gross monthly salary between €4,516 and €6,449 (scale 09)
  • Thirteenth month's salary and 8% holiday allowance
  • 10% Employee Benefit Budget
  • EUR 1,400 development budget per year
  • Hybrid working: balance between home and office work (possible for most roles)
  • A pension, for which you can set the maximum amount of your personal contribution

Or view all our benefits.

Medior Analytics Translator Transaction Monitoring – Model Operations & Delivery

We are looking for a medior Analytics Translator to join our high-performing team focused on the operational delivery and governance of Rabobank’s transaction monitoring software. In this role, you will work closely with data engineers, DevOps engineers, product owners and other technical experts to ensure that model components are reliably deployed, well-documented, and compliant with internal standards. You will play a key role in bridging the gap between technical implementation and business needs, ensuring that the software runs smoothly in production and delivers high-quality, actionable alerts to stakeholders across the organization.

You and Your Job

As a medior analytics translator, you play a pivotal role in shaping and guiding the delivery and operationalization of Rabobank’s transaction monitoring model. With a clear and comprehensive understanding of the combination of systems, tools, and processes that support the deployment, operation, and governance of Rabobank’s transaction monitoring software you actively collaborate with data engineers, DevOps engineers, and data scientists to define requirements, improve processes, and ensure smooth delivery of model components to production. You do not code yourself, but you enable your colleagues by providing the necessary context, aligning on objectives, conducting analyses, and ensuring clarity in communication.

You take ownership of improving and optimizing platform-related processes to ensure scalability, reliability, and compliance across teams. Your responsibilities often extend across multiple simultaneous projects, where you collaborate with a diverse group of professionals, including engineers, data scientists, product owners, data governance experts, and other analytics translators. You drive strategic discussions, provide actionable insights, and facilitate alignment across stakeholders, ensuring project goals are met effectively and efficiently. Additionally, you actively contribute to a learning environment by participating in regular planning, alignment, and knowledge-sharing sessions with your peers, and you coach and onboard fellow analytics translators.

Practical examples

  • You proactively identify risks and inefficiencies in the release and governance processes, taking ownership to address them effectively. As the owner of our Release Sign-Off and Model Change Documentation processes, you have a comprehensive understanding of the systems, tools, and workflows that support the deployment, operation, and governance of our transaction monitoring software in production. You drive strategic discussions on bottlenecks and improvement opportunities, organize taskforces to address identified issues, and lead implementation planning. You ensure that all changes are traceable, compliant with internal standards, and well-communicated across stakeholders.
  • You take the lead on platform-wide initiatives to improve operational reliability and compliance. For example, you lead a taskforce to design and implement acceptance criteria and monitoring procedures for key operational risks. You collaborate with data engineers, DevOps engineers, and data governance experts to ensure technical and functional feasibility, while maintaining comprehensive documentation of decisions and rationale. Your broad understanding of the transaction monitoring landscape allows you to anticipate the impact of model or environmental changes and adapt governance frameworks accordingly to ensure operational continuity and compliance.
  • You manage a wide range of stakeholders and their expectations, acting as the primary liaison between the squad responsible for productionizing and supporting the transaction monitoring platform and the consumers of model output. You facilitate regular alignment sessions to address operational issues, clarify outstanding questions, and ensure smooth collaboration. For instance, when a new model feature is ready for deployment, you coordinate with developers, release managers, and alert consumers to ensure a seamless rollout. You prepare compelling decision-making proposals, lead workshops, and maintain a clear and accessible knowledge base on our documentation platform. You also support data governance initiatives in our data catalogue platform and contribute to release planning and communication, ensuring that platform activities are well-integrated into the broader transaction monitoring ecosystem.

Top responsibilities

  • Own and improve platform processes such as Release Sign-Off and Model Change Documentation, ensuring compliance, traceability, and operational excellence.
  • Lead cross-functional initiatives to enhance the reliability, scalability, and governance of the transaction monitoring software in production.
  • Act as the primary liaison between the platform squad and consumers of model output, facilitating alignment, managing expectations, and ensuring smooth collaboration.

You and your talent

  • Academic degree in a modelling related field (e.g., data science, economics, econometrics, computer science, physics, mathematics, engineering), and passionate about learning technical subjects.
  • 5-9 years of experience as an analytics translator, business analyst, data analyst, or data scientist with strong consulting skills. Understanding of statistical and/or rule-based models (machine learning is a plus), and able to assess what is functionally and technically feasible and/or desirable.
  • Strong analytical mindset with critical thinking and problem-solving abilities.
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills, able to convey technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders effectively.
  • Proven leadership abilities, including the capacity to guide cross-functional teams, manage conflicts, manage stakeholders, and drive decision-making processes effectively.
  • Strategic thinker capable of anticipating trends and aligning team objectives to organizational goals for maximum impact.
  • Structured, precise, and skilled in prioritization.
  • Proactive, business-focused, and driven to make a difference in combating financial crime.
  • Comfortable working in a dynamic environment with multiple parallel projects, interdependencies, and a wide range of stakeholders.
  • Knowledge or passion for technical topics e.g., programming, CI/CD, and IT.

You and the job application process

  • Any questions about the job content? Contact: Nadia Vendrig, Expert Lead Transaction Monitoring Analytics via Nadia.Vendrig@rabobank.nl.
  • Any questions about working at Rabobank and the process? Contact Lisa Boschma, recruiter, via lisa.boschma@rabobank.nl #LI-LB
  • We will conduct the interviews through a video call.
  • You can find answers to the most frequently asked questions on rabobank.jobs/en/faq.
  • A security check is part of the process.
  • We respect your privacy.

title: Medior Data Scientist
description:
This is what we offer you

  • Gross monthly salary between €4,516 and €6,449 (scale 09)
  • Thirteenth month's salary and 8% holiday allowance
  • 10% Employee Benefit Budget
  • EUR 1,400 development budget per year
  • Hybrid working: balance between home and office work (possible for most roles)
  • A pension, for which you can set the maximum amount of your personal contribution

Or view all our benefits.

Medior Data Scientist

Are you passionate about developing, maintaining machine learning models? Do you thrive in a collaborative, fast-paced environment where you can shape the future of ML-driven products? Good! Then read on...

You and your job

As a Medior Data Scientist, you will work on developing, maintaining, improving and implementing machine learning models. You will be at the forefront of creating models that help solve complex challenges, streamline processes, and unlock new opportunities.

We are looking for a Data Scientist with strong engineering capabilities, someone who can dive deep into data, work with machine learning models (especially tree based and clustering models) and take solutions from prototype to production. You will work across the full ML lifecycle, contributing to scalable, reliable, and responsible solutions with a hands-on programming on production ready code.

Facts & figures

  • 36 hours a week.
  • 43,822 Rabobank colleagues around the world.

Top responsibilities

  • Develop, maintain, improve and implement machine learning models in practice
  • Combine and analyse data to create high end model input
  • Write production ready code to deploy a machine learning model
  • Work independently and as part of the model development team
  • Provide written and verbal explanations on ideas, frameworks, models and implementations
  • Engage with IT in a DevOps fashion to bring the models to production

Together we achieve more than alone

We believe that bringing together people's differences is what makes us an even better bank. Talking of Rabobank: We are a Dutch bank that operates in 38 countries for over 9,5000,000 customers. Together with these customers, our members and partners we stand side by side to create a world in which everyone has access to enough healthy food. In the Netherlands we work to create a country in which people are happy with how they live, work and do business.

Within Rabobank, Analytics Acceleration is an ambitious department that aims to mix in a healthy dose of experience, innovation and creativity to develop innovative products and services. We focus on fast learning, delivering value quickly and being more effective. As a team, you work on clear goals and continuously see the results of your (team) efforts.

You and your talent

  • You have at least 4 years of experience working as a Data Scientist or in a similar field
  • You have expertise in statistical modeling and machine learning, especially practical experience with tree based and clustering models
  • You have experience in model deployment, performance tuning, and monitoring leveraging MLOps/DevOps
  • Hands-on person who likes spending time on writing production ready code (Python, PySpark)
  • Proficient with PySpark and Databricks
  • You have experience with cloud platforms, preferably Azure
  • You are skilled in Git and CI/CD pipeline development
  • You have experience with ETL processes, data pipelines, databases and data lakes
  • Basic banking knowledge (optional, nice to have)
  • Experience with Kedro (optional, nice to have)
  • You communicate well in English (both spoken and written).
  • You are curious by heart and experienced in collaboration with internal stakeholders

You and the job application process

title: Senior Data Scientist
description:
Description

Ready to fly? Take the first step and apply! We will make sure you can excel as a High-Flyer.

‍

About our High-Flyer model

At Blackbirds, we do things a little differently. We believe you deserve more as a consultant than a standard salaried model. That is why we have our High-Flyer program: a remuneration model in which you have the freedom of freelancing, with the security and support of a permanent job. You set your own course, work on challenging projects and receive a salary that truly matches your expertise.


About Blackbirds
Blackbirds is a dynamic consulting firm specializing in Data Management. We believe in a working environment where innovation, flexibility and entrepreneurship are key. We are looking for professionals who are not afraid to take initiative and think outside the box.

What will you do?
As a Senior Data Scientist, you'll help companies work smarter by tackling complex data challenges. You will build predictive models, optimize AI solutions and translate data into strategic insights. ‍

Why Blackbirds?

  • Top Reward: Earn a salary according to our High-Flyer Model, with advancement opportunities and high bonuses that can lift your pay far above the market average for outstanding performance!
  • High-Flyer program: benefit from a healthy lunch and fruit at the office, a health program, an NS business card, a training budget of €2500 per year, pension accrual, a 'work hard, play hard' bonus package, and a beautiful office location in Little-C on the 5th floor with a view of the Rotterdam Skyline. In addition, you will receive a laptop and phone allowance
  • Work on groundbreaking projects: Dive into challenging and innovative projects within Data Management and work with the latest technology
  • Flexibility at its best: Enjoy ultimate flexibility in your work. Work less, choose specific days or even refuse an assignment? It's all possible!
  • Professional growth: Get coaching and mentoring from experienced professionals and learn from experts during projects
  • Dynamic work environment:Work in an energetic environment where entrepreneurship is encouraged
  • Local work hub: Work with colleagues and clients in your area

Skills:

  • Extensive experience with programming languages such as Python, R, or SQL
  • Experience with cloud data platforms such as AWS, Azure or Google Cloud
  • Experience with machine learning frameworks such as TensorFlow or PyTorch
  • An entrepreneurial mindset and drive to really make an impact

Training Requirements:

  • Relevant education completed (bachelor's or master's degree)

Experience:

  • 5 years of relevant work experience

Responsibilities:

You deal with:

  • Designing and implementing machine learning algorithms and models
  • Analyze large and complex data sets
  • Developing predictive and prescriptive models
  • Collaborating with customers and stakeholders
  • Innovate with new AI tools and techniques
  • Supervise junior data scientists
