title: Cloud DevOps Engineer
description:
DevOps Engineer

Wil jij aan de slag voor grote nationale en internationale opdrachtgevers? En ben jij op de hoogte van alle ins en outs van een goede PaaS omgeving, microservices, automation, migraties en integratiesy, geautomatiseerd testen, public en hybrid cloud? Ben je op zoek naar veel ruimte voor eigen verantwoordelijkheid en heb je grote interesse in IT en engineering? Lees dan gauw verder!

Jouw mogelijkheden als DevOps Engineer bij Capgemini

Als (aanstormend) DevOps Engineer binnen Cloud Infrastructure Services (CIS) kom je te werken in een enthousiast en zelfsturend team. Het DevOps team draagt zorg voor de ontwikkeling en operatie van diverse PaaS omgevingen, waarbij de nadruk ligt op self-service en automation. Het team bestaat uit ongeveer 10 medewerkers verdeeld over diverse disciplines (Back-end, Front-end, DevOps) en verschillende kennisgebieden (denk aan, Linux, Windows, Splunk, Ruby, Docker, Xl-Deploy en Puppet).

Je bent verantwoordelijk voor de analyse, het ontwerp en de realisatie van verschillende microservices en componenten, waaruit het platform is opgebouwd. De werkzaamheden betreffen de ontwikkeling van nieuwe componenten, migraties van bestaande componenten en het realiseren van integraties met verwante systemen. Je kunt zowel zelfstandig als in teamverband ‘user stories’ oppakken en software opleveren die voorzien is van geautomatiseerd testen en eenvoudig beheersbaar is.

Momenteel draait het platform op een Private Cloud omgeving, maar vanwege de voorgenomen uitbreiding van het PaaS platform naar de Public Cloud, zijn we met name op zoek naar gedegen kennis van de Public Cloud. Het gaat dan om het (geautomatiseerd) inrichten van een multi-tenant omgeving in de Public Cloud (voorkeur voor Azure en AWS), maar ook het definiëren en opzetten van de ‘landing zone’, zoals inrichting netwerk, account setup, policies, billing, iam, etc.

Jouw verantwoordelijkheden:

  • Het opzetten van de geautomatiseerde basis inrichting van één of meerdere Public Cloud omgevingen ter vervanging van onze huidige Private Cloud
  • Een bijdrage leveren aan de uitbouw, het aanpassen en verbeteren van de bestaande PaaS platformen
  • Door middel van verdere automatisering het verbeteren van operationele processen
  • Het proactief systeem- en procesverbeteringen voorstellen
  • Zorgen voor continue verbetering van kwaliteit tijdens ontwikkeling en acteren op verbetervragen
  • Het ontsluiten van Public Cloud, ten einde een Hybrid Cloud oplossing te implementeren
  • Keuzes maken, implementeren en vastleggen omtrent de inrichting van de Public Cloud
  • Het opstellen van documentatie en de overdracht van softwareoplossingen

Jouw thuisbasis bij Capgemini

Internationale carrièremogelijkheden en fantastische expertise netwerken. Met meer dan 270.000 collega's wereldwijd en meer dan 7000 collega's alleen al in Nederland, word je omringd door een brede, technisch intensieve community van gemotiveerde collega's. Innovatieve, complexe- en uitdagende projecten voor bekende, vaak multinationale opdrachtgevers, ondersteund door wereld leidende partners en de zekerheid van een vast dienstverband bij een succesvolle internationale adviesorganisatie.

Benefits

Een grote organisatie met een fijne werksfeer en waar mensen er écht toe doen. Daarbij werk je aan uitdagende projecten en met de nieuwste technologieën voor grote nationale en internationale organisaties. Naast het harde werken trekken we er ook regelmatig op uit voor een teamborrel of etentje. En organiseert onze personeelsvereniging ook meerdere keren per jaar leuke activiteiten. Wat je nog meer kunt verwachten?

  • Cold feet? Kennen we niet. Bij ons krijg je direct een vast contract.
  • All You Can Train zonder enige verplichtingen.
  • Een goed gevulde koffer met vakantiegeld én genoeg tijd (26 dagen) om het uit te geven.
  • Een premievrij pensioen
  • Werk waar je maar wilt op een device naar keuze met onze connectiviteitsvergoeding.
  • Je eerste levensbehoefte als professional: een snelle laptop en een simkaart die je ook privé mag gebruiken.
  • Altijd lekker onderweg met je leaseauto of NS-businesscard. Of kies voor uitbetaling van je reiskostenvergoeding.
  • En uiteraard een passend salaris. Hierover gaan we graag met je in gesprek.

Waarom past deze vacature bij jou?

  • Goede communicatieve skills in het Nederlands: je schrijft heldere stukken en kunt ook mondeling overtuigend je verhaal overbreng
  • Je beschikt over een afgeronde HBO of WO ICT-opleiding
  • Vloeiend in Nederlands en Engels (zowel in woord als geschrift)
  • Minimaal 2-5 jaar werkervaring, als Platform engineer, in het ontwikkelen en onderhouden van een IaaS platform in de Public Cloud
  • Aantoonbare ervaring met gebruik van configuratiemanagement tooling voor Public Cloud inrichting
  • Aantoonbare ervaring met container oplossingen zoals Docker (Swarm) en Kubernetes
  • Ervaring met Agile/Scrum ontwikkelprocessen en Continuous Integration & Delivery
  • Kennis van geautomatiseerd testen

Get the future you want

Die belofte doen wij aan jou. Dat begint al op dag één. Met een goede onboarding en gestructureerde en transparante groeipaden. Maar ook: volop mogelijkheden om daarvan af te wijken, zelf te pionieren en je eigen weg te kiezen. Daarbij kun je van onze kant rekenen op grenzeloos vertrouwen én collegiale support.

Werken bij Capgemini betekent ook werken in het internationale hart van de innovatie. De eredivisie van de technologie. Een werkgever met oog voor jou en het vizier op de toekomst, waarin duurzaamheid en diversiteit en inclusie de hoofdrollen spelen.

title: Senior Technical Product Manager (ML/AI)
description:
Why work at Nebius
Nebius is leading a new era in cloud computing to serve the global AI economy. We create the tools and resources our customers need to solve real-world challenges and transform industries, without massive infrastructure costs or the need to build large in-house AI/ML teams. Our employees work at the cutting edge of AI cloud infrastructure alongside some of the most experienced and innovative leaders and engineers in the field.

Where we work
Headquartered in Amsterdam and listed on Nasdaq, Nebius has a global footprint with R&D hubs across Europe, North America, and Israel. The team of over 800 employees includes more than 400 highly skilled engineers with deep expertise across hardware and software engineering, as well as an in-house AI R&D team.

The role

We are seeking a Senior Technical Product Manager, ML/AI Lifecycle Services to join our team. In this role, you will oversee the planning and prioritization of services across the ML/AI lifecycle, including data preparation, training, fine-tuning, experiments, monitoring and inference. You will deliver products for leading AI companies, utilizing thousands GPU within one cluster with cutting-edge hardware. We also provide room for creativity, empowering you to take the initiative and build what you think is best.

Responsibilities:
  • Be a center of ML/AI expertise for both dev and business teams.
  • Own the backlog of 1–3 AI/ML products.
  • Make technical requirements for IaaS and PaaS teams that are essential for your products.
  • Introduce and promote products to the market in collaboration with cross-functional teams.
  • Make materials and onboarding guides for Solution Architect teams and Sales.
  • Be an internal customer for a Marketplace and Solution Architects teams to build E2E scenarios using our products.


Requirements:
  • We expect the candidate to be the best user of the product they manage, so technical expertise is mandatory.
  • Have solid experience as an ML Engineer/MLOps Engineer/AI Engineer with one or more domains from the following list:
Distributed training that utilizes at least dozens of hosts using Slurm, Ray Cluster, MosaicML
Organizing ML infrastructure using best MLOps practices with instruments like MLflow, W&B, MosaicML, Kubeflow, Apache Airflow, ClearML, AzureML, SageMaker, VertexAI
Maintaining and optimizing a large inference cluster with KServe, vLLM, Triton, RunAI, Seldon
Experience using of data preparation tools like Databricks and Apache Spark
Building a product on top of LLMs that leverages techniques such as RAG, fine-tuning, and function calling, with an understanding of continuous eval of the quality
  • Product management experience is not required but willingness to learn is essential.
Ideal Candidate:
  • You have experience as an ML engineer, specializing in developing large generative AI models. You are now eager to shift your focus toward creating tools and instruments that enhance the efficiency of such teams.
  • You have worked as an MLOps, Solution Architect or DevOps engineer, providing infrastructure for ML teams and delving deeply into ML specifics. You are keen to share your expertise through product development and know how to build MLOPS based on serverless GPU services such as Modal, Cerebrius and Google Cloud Run.
  • You have a background as an ML engineer and transitioned to product management, with a proven track record of delivering complex products for tech customers.

What we offer

  • Competitive salary and comprehensive benefits package.
  • Opportunities for professional growth within Nebius.
  • Hybrid working arrangements.
  • A dynamic and collaborative work environment that values initiative and innovation.

We’re growing and expanding our products every day. If you’re up to the challenge and are excited about AI and ML as much as we are, join us!

title: Junior Devops Engineer
description:
Hi, we are Storyteq!

Storyteq helps marketing and creative teams in top brands to scale their creative production and gain control over their marketing campaigns. Through our platform, our clients can streamline campaign workflows, automate their creative production through templates & AI and activate engaging campaigns that go to market faster. We believe creativity takes time, but creative production shouldn’t. Since 2016 our mission has been to revolutionise the way creative assets are created and used. Magic happens when we let technology empower creativity. Our endless curiosity and relentless commitment to our customers lies at the heart of our problem-solving approach. This shared mission is woven into our values: we dream big, think differently, and are stronger together.

Requirements

About the job:

We are seeking looking for a Junior DevOps/Platform Engineer to join our team! and you will be working with our highly skilled development teams and architects to deliver the best end user experience. You will collaborate closely with the R&D teams across Storyteq, including Developers, fellow DevOps Engineers, Product Owners, and more to deliver the future of our platform.

Your role will revolve around automating our infrastructure, maturing our CI/CD processes and implementing broad GitOps principles that help our teams and products stay in the best possible shape.

The ideal candidate will be passionate about automating infrastructure, ensuring robust CI/CD pipelines, and implementing GitOps principles. You will work with cutting-edge technologies, including ArgoCD, Config Connector, Terraform, Python, and GitLab, to drive the continuous improvement of our development and deployment workflows. The team works on a combination of core application components, infrastructure, deployment flows and tooling. Your role will revolve around all the different elements that will bring our product to new heights. This includes implementing new features, scaling existing capabilities, and making our product more amazing every day. The team works with strong goals and a good balance of product & engineering roadmap features. That way we make sure we always keep our technology and product on track!


Key Responsibilities:

  • Design, build, and maintain scalable, secure, and reliable infrastructure using Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools like Terraform and Config Connector.
  • Implement and manage GitOps workflows with ArgoCD, and develop CI/CD pipelines in GitLab for efficient application deployments and configuration management.
  • Automate repetitive tasks and processes using Python and other scripting languages.
  • Collaborate with development, security, and operations teams to establish best practices, monitor system performance, and contribute to incident response and root cause analysis.
  • Stay updated on emerging trends, technologies, and best practices in DevOps and cloud-native architecture.


Qualifications:

  • Strong communication skills in English.
  • Formal Education or Previous experience in a role that gave you some hands-on exposure experience towith cloud infrastructure and or software development practices
  • A positive attitude and a strong desire to learn and grow
  • A logical analytical thinker with good problem-solving skills
  • Experience working in a team environmentYou're pro-active, result-driven, and excited to work in a fast-growing tech scale-up
  • You're a team player and like to work together to reach our goals


Nice to Have:

  • Experience with observability tools and implementing security best practices for infrastructure and applications.
  • Familiarity with internal developer platforms, streamlined application delivery, and cloud platforms such as Google Cloud, AWS, or Azure.
  • Proficiency in Git-based source control (GitLab, GitHub, Bitbucket) and creating/maintaining CI pipelines.
  • Experience with various database technologies, including MySQL, PostgreSQL, MS SQL, MongoDB, and BigQuery.
  • Knowledge of programming languages and frameworks (JavaScript, Node.js, Golang, Java, Angular, C#.NET) and certifications in GCP, Kubernetes, or Terraform


Benefits

Employee stock ownership.

27 days of annual leave (Well-being Day and Volunteer Day included).

Hybrid working model (working from home 2 days a week).

Travel allowance.

A bicycle lease plan with Hellorider after 1 year of employment.

Excellent tools: High-end Laptop, Monitor, and everything in between!

We support your continuous improvement with training, courses, conferences, and books.

Mental health and wellbeing support: Access to OpenUp.

Office lunches and endless snacks at the Amsterdam Office.

The best Friday afternoon drinks and quarterly team outings.

A Pension contribution for employees who are based in the Netherlands.

Pet-friendly office, so feel free to bring your furry friend!

We Value Diversity
We champion and welcome diversity in our workforce and ensure all job applicants receive equal and fair treatment, regardless of age, race, gender or gender identity, religion, sexual orientation, disability, or nationality.

We are not only committed to increasing the visibility and recognition of talent from under-represented groups within our organisation but the wider industry too.

At the end of the day, we make sure we take time to look after ourselves, each other, and the planet because we’re always stronger together.

ITG have a number of community groups (ERGs) available to employees which offer a safe space for like-minded colleagues, with shared interests to connect, socialise and check in with each other. These include Black ITGers Together, LGBTQ+ Together, Mens Health Together, Muslims Together, Neurodiversity Together, Working Parents and Carers Together and Women In Tech Together.

title: Senior Java Developer – Banking Domain
description:
Location: Amsterdam
Workload: 36–40 hours/week
Contract: Payroll only (no freelancers/ZZP)
Start Date: As soon as possible
Duration: 12 months+
Salary: Excellent compensation based on seniority and experience

We are currently looking for a Senior Java Developer to join a strategic project at a major bank in Amsterdam. You’ll be working in a fast-paced, highly secure environment where stability, scalability, and compliance are key. The team operates in a DevOps setup and follows Agile/Scrum methodologies.

As a developer, you will take part in the design, development, integration, and maintenance of critical backend applications. These systems handle high volumes of sensitive financial transactions and must operate with zero tolerance for downtime. You will be working closely with solution architects, DevOps engineers, business analysts, and QA professionals.

Key Responsibilities

  • Develop and maintain Java backend systems with a strong focus on security and performance

  • Build scalable microservices using Spring Boot, REST APIs, and enterprise integrations

  • Participate in solution design and technical refinement sessions

  • Ensure code quality with unit/integration tests (TDD/BDD), code reviews, and CI/CD

  • Contribute to containerization and cloud migration (Docker/Kubernetes)

  • Collaborate with stakeholders to deliver compliant, future-proof solutions

Required Skills & Experience

  • Minimum 6 years of hands-on experience in enterprise Java development

  • Must have previous experience in banking or financial services IT

  • Expertise in Spring Boot, RESTful APIs, Maven, Git, Docker

  • Experience with CI/CD tooling such as Jenkins, GitLab, Azure DevOps

  • Familiarity with messaging (Kafka, JMS), databases (Oracle, PostgreSQL)

  • Strong understanding of security standards, secure coding practices, and system integration

  • Excellent communication skills in English

  • Agile/Scrum team experience

We Offer

  • A long-term engagement on a visible and impactful program

  • Collaboration with experienced professionals in a high-performance environment

  • An excellent salary package and always-on-time payments

  • Opportunity to contribute to digital transformation within banking

Please apply only if you are immediately available.
Send your CV (in Word format), your availability, your hourly rate, and a brief motivation to valentijn@profi-workers.nl .

title: GCP Solution Architect in Pricing
description:
• REQ-10097860
  • 30/06/2025
  • IT Architecture
  • Amsterdam, Nederland
  • 2.496,00 - 3.114,31 per month
  • ING Bank


We are looking for an eperienced GCP Solution Architect to enhance the design and implementation of cloud solutions on Google Cloud Platform. Your focus will be on optimizing infrastructure for performance, scalability, reliability, security, and operational efficiency—ensuring strong alignment between architecture, implementation, and business goals.

You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to translate business requirements into scalable, cloud-native architectures that follow best practices and support ING’s strategic objectives.

The team

The ING Pricing Architecture (IPA) platform supports real-time and batch calculations of financial risk metrics and simulations—such as VA, PFE, Value at Risk, Epected Shortfall, Bilateral Margining, and pre-deal derivatives pricing. These capabilities are driven by evolving banking regulations and advanced risk analysis needs for ING’s global derivatives portfolio (interest rates, credit, F).

IPA is a core platform for our global dealing rooms and risk managers across Asia, Europe, and the Americas. It is developed by 7–9 Agile teams located in Amsterdam, Brussels, Bucharest, and Singapore, working together to evolve the platform in line with ING’s Financial Markets IT vision.

Within IPA DARE, our goal is to deliver a fast, secure, and reliable Data, Analysis, and Reporting Environment (DARE)—primarily built on GCP. This platform serves both Front Office and Risk Management users, supporting intraday and end-of-day pricing, risk management, and position management in a unified system.

Roles and responsibilities

Even if you start your day in the comfort of your home or drink your morning coffee at our office cafeteria, your day will be quite similar when it comes to tasks. Here are your daily responsibilities:

  • You design and define GCP-based components and services, shaping the overall IT landscape and strategy.
  • You evaluate end-to-end processes for efficiency, identify risks, and drive continuous improvements across data ingestion, processing, reporting, and analytics.
  • You create clear architecture diagrams, documentation, and presentations for both technical and non-technical audiences. You maintain accurate records of current and future-state processes and required changes.
    • You promote reuse by developing and maintaining automation patterns and cookbooks to ma
  • imize efficiency and consistency. You ensure alignment with ING tech standards and escalate deviations when needed.
  • You focus on high-performance solutions, large-scale data handling, and event-driven architectures.
  • You work closely with stakeholders, product managers, and engineering teams in an agile environment to translate business needs into scalable cloud architectures.
  • You ensure software solutions meet customer needs, are cost-effective, and comply with security and regulatory standards.
  • You provide technical leadership and mentorship to development and DevOps teams. You guide teams in adopting best practices and reusable solutions.
  • You keep up with GCP innovations, emerging technologies, and industry trends to inform architectural decisions.
  • You lead initiatives for cloud migration and modernization, including refactoring and rearchitecting legacy systems.
  • You collaborate with other platform teams and vendors to implement or upgrade systems and influence technical roadmaps.
  • You maintain deep knowledge of organizational policies and regulatory requirements, ensuring team adherence and addressing non-compliance when necessary.
  • You identify and propose cost-saving opportunities within the data platform.

How to succeed

Eperience & Qualifications:

5+ years of e
  • perience in IT, including 2+ years in cloud architecture roles.
    • Proven e
  • perience with big data solutions, either from a cloud architecture or engineering perspective.
  • Proven leadership in guiding project teams and managing stakeholders to ensure successful delivery of objectives.
  • GCP certifications (e.g., Professional Cloud Architect, Data Engineer, or DevOps Engineer) are highly desirable.

Mut-Have:

Hands-on e
  • perience with Google Cloud Platform, including:o BigQuery, Dataflow, Pub/Sub, Cloud Composer, Cloud Run Google Cloud Storage, IAM, IAP, Looker
  • Proficient in: Infrastructure as Code (e.g., Terraform) CI/CD pipelines, DevOps practices, and automation Relational and NoSQL databases Data governance, data lineage, and data cataloging DBT (Data Build Tool) IT security concepts and best practices

Nice-to-Have:

E
  • perience with hybrid or multi-cloud environments
  • Familiarity with data engineering tools such as Kafka, Spark, or Flink
  • Knowledge of compliance frameworks (e.g., GDPR)

Foreign languages: English (advanced)

Education: A University degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering or equivalent.

Rewards and benefits

We want to make sure that it’s possible for you to strike the right balance between your career and your private life. Find out more about our employment conditions.

The benefits of working with us at ING include:

A salary tailored to your qualities and e
  • perience.
  • 24-27 vacation days depending on the contract.
  • Pension scheme.
  • 13th-month salary.
  • Individual Savings Contribution (BIS), 3.5% of your gross annual salary.
  • 8% Holiday payment.
  • Hybrid working to blend home working for focus and office working for collaboration and co-creation.
  • Growth opportunities

About us
Curious about how ING empowers people and businesses to move forward? Discover what we do and what we can offer you.

Questions?
Contact the recruiter attached to the advertisement. Want to apply directly? Please upload your CV and motivation letter by clicking the ‘Apply’ button.


Your place of work
Eplore the area

Questions? Just ask
Elias Noya

Diversiteit, gelijkheid en inclusie staan bij ons altijd voorop. title: Cloud Engineer (7 - 11k per maand!)
description:
FLUENCY IN DUTCH ONLY

Cloud & DevOps engineers opgelet!

Ben jij een gedreven Cloud Engineer en/of DevOps Engineer met passie voor de nieuwste platform technieken? Bij Citrus hebben we de meest uitdagende opdrachten voor Cloud Engineers zoals jij! Of je nu wilt schitteren in high-end security teams of als DevOps Engineer aan de wieg wilt staan van een nieuw data platform, bij ons vind je de perfecte match.

OVER JOU
Bij Citrus zoeken we communicatief sterke Cloud / DevOps Engineers die resultaatgericht te werk gaan en de platforms van onze opdrachtgevers naar een hoger niveau tillen. Je vaardigheden in het technisch vertalen van klantvragen zijn onmisbaar. Daarnaast ben je ook klantgericht en heb je kennis van de volgende zaken hieronder:

  • Ontwerpen, implementeren en onderhouden van gedistribueerde systemen en cloudinfrastructuur (zoals bijv. Linux)

  • Kennis van automatiseringstools en -technieken, zoals Terraform, Ansible, Puppet of Chef, inclusief het implementeren van Infrastructuur as Code (IaC).

OVER CITRUS

  • Keuzevrijheid – Bij Citrus heb je keuzevrijheid. Wij hebben het juiste netwerk voor elk project waar jij je tanden in wilt zetten. Werk je graag met Azure of juist AWS, met Kubernetes of Docker? Het kan allemaal!

title: DevOps Engineer (Kubernetes, AWS)
description:
DevOps Engineer (Kubernetes, AWS)

We are the cloud transformation team that supports the business teams in transforming towards cloud native and migrating the applications to AWS. Together with your teammates, you will be deeply involved in the migration activities and support of the business teams during this process.

You will be part of the team that builds the GitOps capabilities to provisioning AWS and other infrastructure with Crossplane.


  • Degree in computer science or equivalent working experience

  • Hands on experience with declarative based infrastructure as code (preferably Crossplane or Terraform)

  • Experience in software engineering (Go, Python)

  • Public cloud experience, preferably with AWS technologies

  • Practical project hands-on experience with Kubernetes

  • Analytical thinking and troubleshooting skills: developing orchestration with declarative frameworks is not that intuitive as one might think, so perspicacity and attention to details are a must!

  • Excellent problem-solving skills to develop quick and effective solutions for complex issues

  • Open to changes, to learn new things and to share own ideas

  • Team-oriented, highly adaptable, with a flair for continuous improvement

  • Proficiency in English

Want to know more about us?

We are serving the Swiss market as Switzerland’s leading IT & Telecom company. Thus, we are actively driving digitalization and networking, and tapping new paths for our customers and our employees. Our values are trustworthy, committed and curious.


Since 2019, we have been building up the coolest DevOps Center with a wonderful office at the World Trade Center in the heart of Rotterdam. We are currently recruiting IT passionate professionals who are keen on developing high-quality software, have an agile mindset and appreciate the collaboration with motivated colleagues from all over the world.


What's in it for you?

Work environment

  • Agile way of working, multi-cultural work environment promoting work-life balance

  • Autonomy, flexibility, opportunity and growth

  • Cool office space in the World Trade Center Rotterdam!

  • Are you coming to the office by bike or car? You can park right here at the office

  • Be a part of our events to build a stronger Swisscom community - for example, culture lunches, fun quizzes, game nights and a lot more!

Allowances

  • Full relocation support (Housing, settling in, etc.) for you and your family

  • 200 euros per month Telephone/internet allowance

  • 275 euros per month contribution to health insurance

  • 5 Paid training days and access to Swisscom learning platforms

  • Travel allowance reimbursement

  • 500 euros home office allowance

  • Gym subscription, Tax advice, and language course

Leaves policy

  • Work from abroad possibility for one month per year

  • Care, bereavement, maternity and paternity leaves

  • 25 days paid vacation days plus Dutch national holidays

Contract terms

  • To begin with you will receive a fixed term contract (one year), after 6 months of your employment with us, after a feedback meeting with the team, there is a possibility of extending the contract

  • The salary ranges mentioned in our Job Descriptions are base annual gross salaries including the 8% holiday allowance
company_description: Als Nr. 1 inspirieren wir die Menschen in der vernetzten Welt. Mit den neusten Technologien und Innovationen haben wir gemeinsam die Möglichkeit, die Zukunft zu gestalten. Dafür sind und handeln wir .

title: Google Cloud Platform Engineer
description:
Are you excited by the idea of architecting and managing cloud infrastructure that powers complex web applications and data processing systems?
Can you design and implement scalable, secure, and cost-effective solutions using Google Cloud Platform services?
And can you do all of this while maintaining operational excellence and reliability?
Then don't wait another minute to apply!

‍ What we are doing?

Kaizo aims to actively guide employees towards achieving their goals and making an impact at their companies.

We are building a performance development platform for customer support teams that leverages gamification and AI to improve operational efficiency, elevate teams' performance and retention with actionable goals. We are a product-led, fast-growing SaaS company with a diverse team and a globally active customer base.

Kaizo is leveraging gamification and machine learning to make the daily work experience for customer support agents more engaging, fun and productive.

We run our entire infrastructure on Google Cloud Platform, managing Kubernetes clusters that handle 200+ million events daily, with data flowing through Kafka streams and being stored in Elasticsearch and MongoDB.

Our cloud architecture is designed around GCP best practices to create a resilient, auto-scaling infrastructure that supports our microservices ecosystem and data processing pipelines.

️ What are your 12 labours here?

  • Designing and implementing cloud infrastructure solutions in a fast-paced startup environment

  • Managing and optimizing GCP services

  • Building Infrastructure as Code using Terraform and implementing CI/CD pipelines with Github actions

  • Working with development teams to architect scalable, secure, and cost-effective cloud solutions

  • Monitoring system performance, implementing observability solutions, and ensuring high availability across all services

  • Analyzing infrastructure needs, suggesting improvements to our cloud architecture with freedom to implement innovative solutions

  • Implementing and maintaining security best practices to ensure a secure and protected cloud environment, including IAM policies, network security, and compliance frameworks


‍ What you bring to the table?

  • 3+ years of professional experience with Google Cloud Platform services and cloud infrastructure management

  • Strong experience with Kubernetes, Docker containerization, and orchestration at scale

  • Experience managing and scaling Kafka clusters, Elasticsearch deployments, and MongoDB instances in production environments

  • Proficiency with Infrastructure as Code tools (Terraform, Deployment Manager) and CI/CD pipelines

  • Experience with monitoring and observability tools (New relic, Logging, APM solutions)

  • Knowledge of networking, security best practices, and cost optimization in cloud environments

  • Experience working within cross-functional teams, collaborating with Product Managers, developers, and DevOps engineers

  • BS/Masters degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or equivalent experience

What's in it for you?

  • An office right in the heart of Amsterdam

  • Great office gear: MacBook, tools, desks, chair — there's something for everyone

  • Flexible schedule, remote work (within the EU time zone) whenever needed

  • Fun workations (2019: Tuscany, 2020: Zoom , 2021: Portugal, 2022: Italy) & open holiday policy

Psst. Do you want to help us understand what makes you the best match for this role? Feel free to send us a 2-minute video motivation.

Up for a heart-to-heart?

title: Senior DevOps Engineer (Fintech platform)
description:
3 reasons you should join our team as Senior Devops Engineer

  • Pioneer our infrastructure evolution - from setting up data warehouses to templating Kubernetes applications
  • Own mission-critical systems processing billions in transactions (no pressure, we’ve got your back)
  • Join a tight-knit team that values learning from mistakes over pointing fingers and allows you to come as you are.

At OPP, we're building the infrastructure backbone for Europe's leading marketplaces, and we need a technical pioneer who gets excited about both system architecture and teamwork to support us. Unlike traditional roles where you're maintaining someone else's infrastructure, you'll be designing and maintaining everything from scratch. Our secret? We keep all infrastructure in-house, giving you maximum impact and endless opportunities to think of new solutions.

Take our platform to the next level
When millions of users trust platforms like Marktplaats and Nature.house with their payments, your infrastructure makes it possible. You'll be working with a sophisticated AWS environment that combines EC2 instances and Kubernetes clusters, backed by MySQL, OpenSearch, and Redis. Think GitLab with scalable CI/CD, Terraform for infrastructure as code, and Lambda functions - all powering billions in yearly transactions.

Depending on your expertise and interests, you'll dive into:
+ Optimize the lifecycle of our software - from code to release.
+ Design, build and implement cloud solutions that perfectly fit within our AWS environment.
+ Focus on setting up new workflows, monitoring and testing performance and introducing tools and new technologies. Think of docker, microservices and containerization.

Your track record tells us

+ At least 5 years of relevant working experience
+ You’re an A-class pro in AWS
+ You have experience with high-traffic, high-performance platforms.
+ Broad knowledge of automation and infrastructure
+ Experience with GitLab, CI/CD pipelines, AWS, Kubernetes en Terraform (or Cloudformation).
+ You know your way around application testing
+ You know how to keep infrastructure stable, scalable, and secure
Please note: To be eligible for this position, you must reside in the Netherlands..

How we invest in you
Great technology is as strong as the people who build it. If you bring the skills and a customer-first mentality, we’ll bring the tools you need to build amazing, robust products. We also offer you:

+ An all-in salary up to €95.000 annually
+ Flexible working hours, hybrid working, 24 paid vacation days, and 2 diversity days.
+ Contract for 12 months with the possibility to extend - we’re in this for the long haul!
+ Macbook, home office gear, and NS Business card.+ Office lunches plus regular get-togethers over drinks.

Ready to supercharge yourself?
Send your credentials our way and let’s talk. More info? Direct your questions to Gijs Cooijmans at gijs.cooijmans@onlinepaymentplatform.com. Or give him a call first at +31 6 31 32 88 65.

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Permanent

Pay: Up to €95.000,00 per year

Expected hours: No more than 40 per week

Work authorization:

  • Nederland (Required)

Work Location: Hybrid remote in 2628 EB Delft

title: Software & DevOps Engineer
description:
Wij vragen

    HBO / WO opleiding of denkniveau.

    Kennis van .NET en C#.

    Kennis van SQL.

    (Senior) werkervaring in de rol van ops engineer.

    Kennis van Azure Cloud.

    Kennis van Terraform.

    Kennis van Jira en Azure DevOps.

    Je bent in staat om zowel zelfstandig als in teamverband te werken.

    Goede communicatieve vaardigheden, een toegankelijke persoonlijkheid en beheersing van de Nederlandse taal.

    Het kunnen overleggen van een recente Verklaring Omtrent Gedrag (VOG) is onderdeel van de aannameprocedure.

Wij bieden

    Je komt te werken in een informele, missie gedreven organisatie waar duurzaamheid centraal staat.

    Salaris ligt tussen de € 3.241,00 en € 5.295,00 afhankelijk van o.a. relevante kennis, vaardigheden en ervaring die je meebrengt.

    Laptop van de zaak.

    Hechte teams dat continu samen wil verbeteren.

    Een uitdagende, verantwoordelijke en zelfstandige functie.

    28 verlofdagen bij fulltime dienstverband, hybride werken en een goede pensioenregeling.

    Mogelijkheid tot werken met de nieuwste software.

    Ontwikkelingsmogelijkheden en toegang tot INNAX Online Academy.

    Steun voor jouw sportieve ambities (fietsregeling, regeling voor bedrijfsfitness bij ca. 3200 sportlocaties).

Wat doe je als Software & DevOps Engineer?

Wil jij als Software & DevOps Engineer graag werken aan specialistische producten die wij zelf ontwikkelen? En lijkt het je ook mooi om te werken binnen een organisatie waar duurzaamheid centraal staat? Lees dan vooral door: de functie Software & DevOps Engineer zou dan maar zo bij je kunnen passen!


Bij INNAX werken we aan een toekomst waar iedereen energie van krijgt. Dit doen wij met specialistische producten die wij zelf ontwikkelen en hosten on-premise en in de Azure Cloud. Deze producten zijn een belangrijke steunpilaar voor ons en onze klanten, om mee te bewegen in de energie transitie en slim te navigeren naar een duurzame toekomst.

Als Software & DevOps Engineer ben je verantwoordelijk voor de ontwikkeling en verdere optimalisatie van software voor diverse producten. De producten dienen enerzijds voor optimale ondersteuning van al onze meetdiensten en het meetproces (bijv. opslag van meetdata en energiemonitoring) en anderzijds producten voor verschillende proposities op het gebied van verduurzamings- en energieadvies.

Ook help je onze product teams hun producten eenvoudig en veilig uit te rollen naar onze hybride cloud. Je denkt en helpt mee met het opzetten van infrastructure-as-code deployment naar Azure. Je helpt teams met templates om CI/CD te vereenvoudigen, producten observable te maken, monitoring & alerting in te regelen evenals het opzetten van quality of service dashboards.


Over je collega’s

Als Software en DevOps engineer sta je midden in onze data gedreven organisatie met in je nabijheid business developers, product teams, IT support en ons compliancy & security team. Met elkaar zetten we ons in voor een betere toekomst en houden we elkaar graag scherp hoe daar te komen.
company_addresses: We hebben drie kantoren verspreid over Nederland, dus altijd bij jou in de buurt.
company_description: Bij INNAX werken we aan een toekomst waar iedereen energie van krijgt. Is dat de missie waar jij je ook dagelijks voor in wilt zetten? Dan zoeken we jou.

title: AI Developer (Backend-Focused)
description:
About us

At Incision (www.incision.care), our mission is to revolutionize surgical training and ensure that every patient receives the best possible care. We collaborate with surgical professionals and teams worldwide, sharing expertise through our award-winning e-learning platform, featuring 2D & 3D modules, augmented reality, and virtual reality applications.

Our Core Values

Impact & Excellence: we strive for innovation and excellence in surgical education

Learn, Grow, and Share: knowledge should be shared, and we help each other thrive

Teamwork Unleashed: we support, challenge, and celebrate each other’s success.

Are you the AI-savvy Backend Developer who can ship production-ready tools with privacy at the core? Do you get energy from building smart features that directly impact global healthcare? Do you thrive in an innovative, international scale-up atmosphere? Then come join Incision’s in-house Development team in Amsterdam!

About the Role:

As an AI Developer (Backend-Focused) at Incision, you’ll help us bring AI prototypes into production, building secure, privacy-conscious tools for real surgical workflows.
You’ll work closely with our in-house dev team and our engineering partners in Serbia, as well as with our UX Designer, Product Owners, and Data Engineer. You’ll report to our Solution Architect and help shape everything from the technical architecture to the final user experience.
This is a great role for someone who wants to ship meaningful AI features in a domain where privacy, quality, and trust truly matter.

Your role:

  • Integrate and maintain LLM-based features into our production stack (e.g. chatbots, document summarizers, intelligent retrieval)
  • Design RAG pipelines and other AI-backed systems that are robust, scalable, and privacy-safe
  • Implement backend features using Node.js, TypeScript, and AWS (Lambda, S3, OpenSearch, etc.)
  • Ensure compliance with privacy and security standards (GDPR, HIPAA) across all AI features
  • Collaborate on architecture and deployment strategies with our Solution Architect
  • Work closely with the AI-team, UX, Product, and external engineering teams to bring ideas to life


What You Bring

  • 2+ years of experience with Node.js + TypeScript in production
  • Hands-on experience building with AI/LLM tooling (e.g. OpenAI, Gemini, LangChain, vector databases like Pinecone or OpenSearch)
  • Experience with RAG systems and chatbot-like tools in real applications
  • Familiarity with AWS (Lambda, API Gateway, CloudWatch, S3, OpenSearch)
  • Understanding of privacy & data protection requirements in healthcare (GDPR, HIPAA, de-identification, secure handling of patient data)
  • Worked with tools like Cursor, MCPs, Jira, Confluence, Bitbucket, and CLI environments
  • A pragmatic, analytical, and proactive mindset with an eye for detail
  • Excellent English communication skills

What We Offer:

Make a Real Impact: help revolutionize surgical education worldwide!

Cool & Modern Office: work in a stylish, pet-friendly space in Amsterdam.

International Team: join a diverse crew with 10+ nationalities.

Learning & Development: access training, courses, and growth opportunities.

Thursday Borrel: unwind with your team at our weekly get-together!

Hybrid Work Model: flexibility to work remotely and from our Amsterdam HQ.

Career Growth: expand your skills in a fast-paced, innovative environment.

Top-Notch Equipment: choose between Apple or Microsoft laptop, plus office monitor & tools.

Inspiring Team: collaborate with medical professionals and cutting-edge innovators.

Flexible Work Options: 2 days a week.

Free Lunches & Snacks: enjoy delicious meals and treats at the office!

Team & Social Events: regular gatherings to connect, learn, and have fun.

Competitive Salary: get rewarded for your skills and expertise.

Travel Allowance: support for commuting costs.

Pension Plan: secure your future with our retirement benefits.

Mental Health Support: access well-being resources through OpenUp.

Casual Scale-Up Environment: work in a dynamic, fun, and inspiring atmosphere!

Diverse & Inclusive Workplace: be part of an open-minded, supportive culture where everyone is valued.

title: Frontend Developer (Angular)
description:
Are you ready to make a societal contribution as a Frontend Developer by creating more space for human work within the healthcare sector? As a Frontend Developer at ZorgDomein, you will be working daily on building, expanding, and innovating our online environment. As part of the development team, you will collaborate with your colleagues to address the requirements and needs of the users by developing new

features. Next to being part of a development team you will also become a driving force in our Frontend Guild, our diverse and dynamic guild of 10 frontend developers at ZorgDomein! Our group is a mixture of different nationalities, united by a shared passion for creating top-notch digital solutions in healthcare. We pride ourselves on our open and friendly culture, where collaboration and mutual support are key. Plus, we occasionally unwind with some fun and games.

We are ZorgDomein

How can you continually improve healthcare in the Netherlands? How do you make extra time and space for patients, and give them more attention? These are the sort of questions that are central to our work at ZorgDomein. We develop smart technology to create more room for human work in healthcare. That’s how we help healthcare professionals such as family doctors, physiotherapists and lab technicians to do what they do best: give patients the best possible healthcare. We have been doing just that for 25 years.

Established name with ambition

Did you know that nearly all referrals and diagnostic requests are channelled through our platform? In fact, in 2024 our platform was used nearly 24 million times to refer or request research for patients. ZorgDomein is an established name in the Netherlands, but for us the adventure has only just begun. Our healthy ambition is to ensure even better coordination of supply and demand in the healthcare sector. With a user-friendly, high-tech platform and digital solutions. And by building lasting relationships with healthcare professionals. There’s plenty of work to be done at ZorgDomein and we could use your help in it.

Your role at ZorgDomein

As a driving member of our frontend guild, you are directly contributing to one of our main goals which is to connect, socialize, and collaborate with the UX team. We also host regular knowledge-sharing sessions and attend conferences to stay on top of the latest developments in our field.

As a Frontend Developer you also have a key role in designing, building and maintaining the features in your team. Together with your team you will work on building key features that will help empowering the team to work on making the right impact for our end users.

Your key responsibilities are:

  • Improving the user-friendliness of our platform for more than 100,000 customers and 20 million transactions per year
  • Technically designing, implementing, and enhancing features for our end users
  • Monitoring, analysing, and optimizing the performance of our platform
  • Working in a Scrum team with other developers
  • Being an active member of the frontend guild together with your fellow frontend developers and UX colleagues
  • Collaborate with colleagues by practising knowledge sharing, code reviews, and pair programming
  • Writing automated tests to ensure the quality of the code
  • Working based on a CI/CD methodology

About you

  • You have at least 4 years of experience as a frontend developer
  • You have experience with TypeScript, Angular, RXJS, HTML, and CSS/SCSS (Knowledge of React is a plus)
  • You have at least a Bachelor education working and thinking level
  • You enjoy collaborating with colleagues of different nationalities; the working language is English
  • You are proficient in clean code principles, reactive- and modular-development
  • You demonstrate an effective problem-solving perspective and approach

Working in your own way

You will join a hard-working family of 200 colleagues. A great bunch of professionals working together to achieve something valuable: better flow in the Dutch healthcare sector. ZorgDomein employees enjoy working here because the work climate is ideal. The secret? You enjoy the total confidence of your colleagues to do what you do best. That means you have a high degree of autonomy. You have freedom to work in your own way.

Healthy work environment

Are you looking for a work environment where you feel comfortable? ZorgDomein is the right place for you. Here, you can be yourself and work in a way that suits you. We highly value a healthy work-life balance. That’s why we provide a pleasant workplace where you feel at home and can collaborate well with your team.

What else do we offer you:

  • An informal team of enthusiastic and driven professionals that is fully committed to realize the mission on a daily basis
  • A workplace in our beautiful office on the Vecht, but also an ergonomical workspace at home
  • Salary between € 4.500,- and € 5.500,- based on fulltime employment (you are available to work for 32 to 40 hours per week)
  • Flexible leave policy
  • Full payments for your pension policy by ZorgDomein
  • Attention for your growth through personal attention, our development days and an additional personal development budget
  • As a part of the Visma Group you will have access to the Visma learning environment
  • Fun! With our (digital) events and (sport)activities we create an relaxed atmosphere and we will keep you sharp and fit!

Do you see yourself working at ZorgDomein?

In that case, we want to know more about you! You can apply by clicking on the orange button below. If you have any questions about the vacancy, get in touch with recruitment@zorgdomein.nl addressed to Robina Schouten.

title: Test Automation Software Engineer
description:
Full time, Part-time
Bachelor, Master
Antwerpen // Lier // Mechelen

As a member of the R&D team there are needs to improve on their testing effectiveness and efficiency.

Pushing boundaries together and making the impossible possible — that’s our ambition at Sioux. We challenge you to bring out the best in yourself. We work on a wide range of highly complex projects and offer you the opportunity to further develop yourself

What gets you excited as a Test Automation Software Engineer ?

As a member of the R&D team there are needs to improve on their testing effectiveness and efficiency. They already do a lot of testing on various integration levels, from unit tot Hardware-In-Loop testing of components or subsystems of components. On the Hardware-In-Loop testing they see the need of expanding their scope and level of automation. Their intention is to create a Hardware-In-Loop test setup that basically simulates and entire vehicle with all its subsystems. Besides this is massive, the setup also needs to be configurable/adaptable to allow for many variations between the vehicles. Beginning from a proof of concept for this Hardware-In-Loop setup, at the moment the team lack the capacity and guidance from a senior person to make this a success.

  • Developing a HIL test environment that simulates a complete vehicle including all subsystems.
  • The setup must be configurable for different vehicle configurations.
  • You will start development based on a proof of concept.
  • You will work mainly on-site (initially 4 days per week, potentially less later on).

Our Culture

The strength of Sioux lies in our people. That’s why we believe it’s important to fully support your personal and professional development. You’ll be guided by our people managers — all with a technical background — who know what it takes to take the next step, keep you sharp, and challenge you. This way, you’ll discover how to grow in your field, whether through workshops and training programs or by taking on new challenges within our projects.

  • Permanent contract
  • Competitive salary complemented with extra-legal benefits (company car with fuel card, group insurance, hospitalization insurance, expense allowance, meal vouchers, etc.)
  • Personal guidance and support, including an annual evaluation
  • A generous personal training budget of €6,000 per year
  • Fun socials and team activities with colleagues
  • A pleasant working environment, meaningful work, and a positive team spirit
  • Opportunities for growth and career advancement

Your Experience

  • Senior person who is used to taking the lead on the process and technical side, and who likes to interact with various stakeholders: a good ‘Designer’ or a ‘Senior Designer’.
  • Should have experience working with, or even better developing, a Hardware-in-Loop test setup.
  • As there will be a lot of interaction with other stakeholders and the engineer that is already working on the setup, most logical is that the work is mostly executed at location. We expect at the start 4 days/week presence and when the project is on its way, this can be reduced to 3 or maybe 2 days/week.
Further technologies used:
  • Python
  • PythonTest
  • Behave
  • VectorTest
  • Jenkins buildserver integration
Are you interested?

Your new job in 5 steps

Thank you for your interest. We are happy to share our selection process with you. Below you will find the steps we go through. If you have any questions, feel free to contact us. We wish you the best of luck with your application at Sioux Technologies!

  • Interested?
    • Send us your CV and motivation letter.
  • Application received
    • One of our recruiters will review your application and get back to you asap.
  • Introduction
    • We will plan an (online) introduction with a Sioux colleague to find out if there is a match.
  • Follow-up conversation(s)
    • In follow-up conversation(s), we dive into the (technical) depth. In some cases a personality test will be part of the conversation and will be discussed with you. In other cases you will be presented with a (technical) case.
  • Both excited?
    • If we are both enthusiastic, we would like to make you an offer. We will talk you through the offer and discuss it with you. Are you already curious about our terms of employment? You can find them here for the Netherlands, Belgium, Germany.
  • Welcome to Sioux Technologies!
    • We welcome you to Sioux and wish you success with your new challenge!

Privacy Notice for applicants

  • Pre-employment screening and background checks might be part of your application procedure.
  • Your personal information is managed in compliance with the GDPR regulations.

Dirk De Bruycker

manager
jobs@sioux.eu

title: Python Software Engineer
description:
At Capgemini Engineering, the world leader in engineering services, we bring together a global team of engineers, scientists, and architects to help the world’s most innovative companies unleash their potential. From autonomous cars to life-saving robots, our digital and software technology experts think outside the box as they provide unique R&D and engineering services across all industries. Join us for a career full of opportunities. Where you can make a difference. Where no two days are the same.

Your Responsibilities

Location: Herstal

  • Develop and maintain Python-based software tools to support internal projects.
  • Act as a Python expert and Software Tooling Engineer with strong autonomy.
  • Participate in the setup and improvement of Continuous Integration (CI) pipelines using tools such as Jenkins, SonarQube, and JIRA.
  • Contribute to better control of software code (quality, security, traceability).
  • Collaborate with IT and project teams to identify tooling and automation needs.
  • Apply and promote secure development best practices.
  • Participate in the evaluation and future implementation of tools like Black Duck for managing software intellectual property rights.
Works in the area of Software Engineering, which encompasses the development, maintenance and optimization of software solutions/applications.1. Applies scientific methods to analyse and solve software engineering problems.2. He/she is responsible for the development and application of software engineering practice and knowledge, in research, design, development and maintenance.3. His/her work requires the exercise of original thought and judgement and the ability to supervise the technical and administrative work of other software engineers.4. The software engineer builds skills and expertise of his/her software engineering discipline to reach standard software engineer skills expectations for the applicable role, as defined in Professional Communities.5. The software engineer collaborates and acts as team player with other software engineers and stakeholders.

Your profile

  • Strong experience in Python development.
  • Good knowledge of CI/CD tools: Jenkins, SonarQube, JIRA.
  • Experience in a sensitive or regulated environment (defense, security, etc.).
  • Knowledge of software security and intellectual property.
  • Ability to work independently and manage cross-functional responsibilities.
  • Analytical mindset, rigor, and sense of confidentiality.
    • Fluent in French and English
Additional Assets
  • Experience with open-source code analysis or license management tools (e.g., Black Duck).
  • Knowledge of development standards in the defense sector.
  • Experience in DevSecOps environments.

Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market leading capabilities in AI, generative AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem.

title: System Software Engineer
description:
Computer and IT - Leuven | Just now

About the Role

At the imec Hardware Systems and Applications department, we build application-oriented prototypes around unique imec chip-level technology to bridge the gap between research and industrial or societal applications. Together with component and domain experts, we innovate at the system level by designing, implementing, and validating integrated solutions (hard- & software) around novel imec technologies – thereby bringing them to the next maturity level (TRL). Our mission is to demonstrate and validate these systems in relevant environments and generate valuable data for our customers and partners. We are building a multidisciplinary team that has expertise in system engineering, mechanics, electronics, optics, software, product development and quality assurance.

We are looking for an experienced Software Engineer to join the System Software team in Leuven. You will work in multi-disciplinary project teams, together with system engineering, mechanical, electronic, optical, bio-chemical, microfluidic, and other domain experts. Your primary focus will be on the development of system-level software that makes up an integral part of our prototypes. This software will interface with, configure, and test the hardware, orchestrate data acquisition, and take care of configuration, calibration, and data correction. Sometimes GUI applications will be built on top of lower-level APIs, to allow for easier usage of the system by end-users (e.g. imec researchers or external customers).

What you will do

  • Design, implement, and test software modules for desktop environments.
  • Collaborate with hardware, firmware, and system engineering teams to ensure seamless system integration.
  • Contribute to the development of internal tools and automation pipelines using Docker, GitHub, and CI/CD practices.
  • Participate in sprint planning and task tracking activities.
  • Document software components and contribute to knowledge sharing and internal presentations.
  • Maintain and extend in-house developed software libraries and platforms.

What we do for you

We offer you the opportunity to join one of the world’s premier research centers in nanotechnology at its headquarters in Leuven, Belgium. With your talent, passion and expertise, you’ll become part of a team that makes the impossible possible. Together, we shape the technology that will determine the society of tomorrow.

We are committed to being an inclusive employer and proud of our open, multicultural, and informal working environment with ample possibilities to take initiative and show responsibility. We commit to supporting and guiding you in this process; not only with words but also with tangible actions. Through imec.academy, 'our corporate university', we actively invest in your development to further your technical and personal growth.

We are aware that your valuable contribution makes imec a top player in its field. Your energy and commitment are therefore appreciated by means of a market appropriate salary with many fringe benefits.

Who you are

  • Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, or equivalent by experience.
  • 3–5 years of professional experience in software development.
  • Proficiency in C++ and Python restricted.
  • Solid understanding of software engineering principles and a strong commitment to code quality, maintainability, and best practices.
  • Familiarity with embedded systems, hardware interfacing, or real-time data processing.
  • Experience with version control (Git), and Agile development practices.
  • Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work in a collaborative, cross-functional team.
  • Experience with test-driven development (TDD), software testing methodologies, and frameworks such as Google Test.
  • Good understanding of object-oriented programming, software architecture, and data structures.

Nice to Have:

  • Experience with GUI development (e.g., Qt, PyQt) and C#.
  • Exposure to biomedical systems, instrumentation, or signal processing.
  • Familiarity with Jira and Confluence.
  • Experience with microcontrollers, MPSoCs, or single-board computers.
  • Understanding of hardware APIs, data exchange protocols, or data storage formats.
  • Familiarity with containerization technologies such as Docker.


IMEC and its affiliates will not accept unsolicited resumes from any source other than directly from a candidate. IMEC will consider unsolicited referrals and/or resumes submitted by vendors such as search firms, staffing agencies, professional recruiters, fee-based referral services and recruiting agencies (hereafter “Agency”) to have been referred by the Agency free of charge. IMEC will not pay a fee to any Agency that does not have a prior written agreement with IMEC, validated by its HR department, in place regarding a specific job opening and allowing to submit resumes.
company_description: Imec is the world-leading R&D and innovation hub in nanoelectronics and digital technologies.

title: Software engineer for health informatics (F/M/X)
description:
Offer


UCLouvain is hiring a Software engineer for health informatics (F/M/X)


Job Id : SF 37762
Internal and external job posting until 31st of August 2025


For the Institute of Information and Communication Technologies, Electronics and Applied Mathematics (ICTEAM)

Project location: A6K building (near the Central Station), Charleroi, Belgium.
You will also have an office at UCLouvain, Louvain-la-Neuve, Belgium, where many scientific meetings will be held.

Fixed-term, full-time contract, for 1 year duration.

Possibility of part-time remote work.


Introduction


Join us in shaping the future of health informatics. The CLINOM-X project, supported by the European Regional Development Fund, aims to develop an innovative IT infrastructure for the decentralized capture, management, sharing, and analysis of clinomic data. The project will bring together diverse data sources, including biobanks, electronic medical records, ontologies, multi-modal imaging, and multi-omic datasets. You will play a key role in developing the software that powers this innovative platform.

Job description


We are looking for a skilled Software Engineer to develop our platform.
You will focus on server-side programming and build core systems that handle various clinical and biomedical data.
Your contributions will be essential to making the platform reliable, scalable, and secure to support cutting-edge biomedical research.

Key responsabilities :


  • Develop scalable and secure backend software using the appropriate technological stack of your choice (Java, Python, or R) and associated frameworks.
  • Implement effective data storage solutions, optimize data retrieval, and design modern REST APIs. Create simple frontends demonstrating the REST APIs.
  • Work closely with cross-disciplinary teams, including medical professionals, to define requirements and develop new features.
  • Implement robust data handling and processing mechanisms adapted to clinical, multi-omic, and imaging data.
  • Follow modern and secure IT standards in backend development, especially within the medical domain.
  • Ensure compliance with modern, secure IT standards in backend development, with particular attention to the medical domain.
  • Contribute to the improvement of code quality through writing unit tests, automation, and performing code reviews.
  • Keep up to date with the latest advances in software engineering and health informatics.

Required qualifications and skills


  • A master's degree in computer science, civil engineering, bioinformatics, or a related field is required.
  • Proven experience in Java, Python, or R.
  • Experience in backend development, RESTful APIs, and persistence frameworks (e.g., Hibernate for Java, SQLAlchemy for Python, or DBI/dplyr for R).
  • Good analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Ability to work autonomously.
  • Good written and oral communication skills. Fluency in technical English is essential.
  • Applicants must hold a valid visa or work authorization that allows employment in the European Union at the time of application.


Nice-to-have competencies :


  • Knowledge of medical interoperability standards (FHIR, OMOP, SNOMED CT,...) or a strong interest in biomedical data analysis.
  • Familiarity with containerization technologies (Docker, Kubernetes).
  • Experience with front-end software development (HTML, CSS, JavaScript, VueJS, ReactJS, AngularJS,...).
  • Knowledge of French is an asset and will support day-to-day collaboration within the team.

What we offer


  • Opportunity to work on a groundbreaking project related to clinomic data management.
  • A collaborative research environment: The project is hosted by the ICTEAM Institute of UCLouvain and involves close collaboration with leading academic partners in computer science and biomedical research.
  • One-year fixed-term contract, with a possibility of extension.
  • Flexible work hours and reimbursement of public transportation costs.

Please apply online only, until 31st of August 2025


Contact: francois.roucoux@uclouvain.be

title: Internship: Work on an operational level together with...
description:
Are you an enthusiastic student with a passion for software development and would you like to gain practical experience in an international software company within the food & feed industry? At BESTMIX we offer you the chance to work directly with our development team. You get the opportunity to really learn the business and contribute together with experienced colleagues to innovative software solutions for customers worldwide.


Your internship is located at our headquarters in Maldegem, Belgium.

Your impact in our development team

title: Senior Data Scientist
description:
Senior Data Scientist

About us

ENGIE Supply & Energy Management (S&EM) provides energy supply solutions and risk management services to support its clients through their decarbonization journey, while optimizing ENGIE’s assets and contributing to value creation.

ENGIE is a global reference in low-carbon energy and services with a leading energy management business, piloted by its entity "Supply & Energy Management" who built its savoir-faire managing the Group’s large and diverse asset portfolio over 20+ years.

3,600 employees around the world develop our solutions, through +20 international business platforms. We cover the full energy mix: renewable and thermal power, natural gas & LNG, biomass, environmental products. Our experts provide tailor made solutions based on a wide range of savoir-faire in energy management with a strong focus on decarbonation and decentralization.

Our 190,000 clients span the entire value chain: producers, asset developers, financial players, utilities, distributors and industrials. Our global reach and strong local presence enable us to offer these diverse clients tailor-made services and respond to rapid changes in mature or emerging markets alike.

Our 4 areas of expertise:

  • Asset management
  • Energy transition services
  • Energy supply & global commodities
  • Risk management & market access

At S&EM we encourage breakthrough results, team spirit, curiosity and innovation while preserving the right work/life balance for you.

Context

The Expertise Center (EC) Quantitative Research and Modeling (QRM) within S&EM is a team of around 100 quantitative analysts and data scientists. Its mission is to provide advanced quantitative expertise to various Business Platforms (BP) of S&EM. The data scientist sought here will be part of the “Short Term Trading” team of QRM (approximately 10 people) and will be fully dedicated to the BP Power Trading & Commercial (PT&C).

Role

The data scientist will be focused on the activities related to the CWE (i.e., Belgium, France, Germany, Netherlands) short-term power markets (i.e., day-ahead, intraday, imbalance). While the core of this role is deeply technical and delivery-focused, a portion of the expected responsibilities will involve overseeing project progress, ensuring alignment with business goals and coordinating with cross-functional teams. In their hands-on activities, the successful candidate will leverage large amount of data using statistical tools, machine learning and state-of-the art quantitative models to deliver analysis and tools that have a concrete impact on the business, including:

  • Prediction of relevant power market signals (e.g., volumes, prices)
  • Asset (e.g., battery) optimization
  • Trading strategies and algorithms

The daily responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

  • Contributing to the continuous development of improvement of optimization and trading models and tools, as well as leveraging large volumes of data to provide market insight to relevant BPs
  • Tracking and reporting on project milestones, risks and deliverables, as well as coordinating with relevant stakeholders to ensure project alignment with cross-functional teams (e.g., on planning activities or resource allocation issues)
  • Establishing contact with different stakeholders, e.g., traders - to understand their business needs and propose solutions -, analysts - to exchange about ideas, therefore leveraging on the knowledge from peers – and relevant IT teams - to align on topics related to architecture, deployment, etc.

Sought skillset

  • Experience with statistical models, data science techniques (and optimization models) ;
  • Good understanding of the energy business and power markets ;
  • Demonstrated coding skills with Python ;
  • Familiar with version control systems (git), software development (Azure DevOps, Github Actions) ;
  • Excellent communication skills and the ability to explain and convey concise messages about complex issues.

Education and professional background

  • University degree (MSc, PhD) in Computer Sciences, Applied Mathematics, Statistics, Physics, etc.
  • 5+ years of professional experience in a relevant technical role.

Languages

  • Working language is English

Travels

Occasional travel is possible, but limited.


If you meet these requirements, then you are the talent we are looking for. Do not waste time!

Apply by attaching your updated CV, regardless your gender.


ENGIE S&EM is committed to create a gender-neutral environment that unlocks the potential of everyone and provides equal employment opportunities for all individuals.


All our positions are open to people with disabilities, please let your recruiter know if you need reasonable accommodations to be able to participate in the recruitment process, they will be happy to assist you.


About ENGIE

Our group is a global reference in low-carbon energy and services. Our purpose (“raison d’être”) is to act to accelerate the transition towards a carbon-neutral world, through reduced energy consumption and more environmentally-friendly solutions, reconciling economic performance with a positive impact on people and the planet. We rely on our key businesses (gas, power, renewable energy, services) to offer competitive solutions to our customers. With our 96,000 employees, our customers, partners and stakeholders, we are a community of Imaginative Builders, committed every day to more harmonious progress.


Business Unit: GEMS
Division: GEMS - EC QUANTITATIVE RESEARCH & MODELING
Legal Entity: ENGIE GLOBAL MARKETS, BELGIAN BRANCH
Professional Experience: Skilled ( >3 experience <15 years)
Education Level: Master's Degree

Why this matters to us

Our organisation is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace. We offer reasonable accommodations upon request for individuals with disabilities.

title: Energy and climate Data Scientist
description:
Deadline for applications: applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis. First interviews will take place by the end of July.

Start date: September 2025 (flexible).

Duration: one-year contract (renewable based on performance).

The role will provide broad data assistance to the Bruegel energy and climate research team and, occasionally, to other data intensive projects of Bruegel.

  • To apply, candidates must hold a valid work permit or be authorised to work in Belgium. The candidate must be fluent in English.
  • Applicants must hold a bachelor’s degree in a quantitative or technical field, and a Master’s degree is preferred. An outstanding open-source data portfolio can be considered as a substitute.
  • Minimum three years work experience deploying data solutions, broadly aligned with the specific requirements outlined below.

Bruegel as an organisation

Bruegel is a European think tank working in the field of international economics. Established in 2005, Bruegel is independent and non-doctrinal. Its mission is to improve the quality of economic policy with open and fact-based research, analysis and debate. We are committed to impartiality, openness and excellence. Bruegel’s Membership includes European Member State governments, international corporations and institutions.

The energy and climate team explores a broad range of European policy issues including EU energy markets development, clean industrial policy, the social dimension of EU climate policy, energy security as well as the interplay of energy, climate and competitiveness in the EU.

The role

Bruegel produces policy papers and datasets. The research for these products is built upon objective and high-quality analysis of data. The data specialist is expected to contribute toward and progressively take responsibility across a broad data pipeline.

A rough sketch of how data feeds into the Bruegel research process is as follows.

Bruegel researchers determine an information gap and investigate sources that could fill said gap. Solutions typically include: APIs for accessing data, Python for data manipulation, MongoDB for storage, Cloud infrastructure for computing, and Next.js for frontend visualisation. The ideal candidate would already have experience working with this framework, but experience in similar tools will be considered. The ideal candidate is expected to be able to review, manage and improve the aforementioned pipeline.

Bruegel’s research uses open-source language models. Experience deploying solutions using Hugging Face models is highly appreciated.

Bruegel’s research and use of data is continually evolving. The ideal candidate is passionate to contribute own ideas in driving this research agenda forward. We value previous experience on personal projects, participation to hackathons and technical conferences, and demonstration of continuous learning. Curiosity, and the desire to learn new frameworks is essential.

The following is an overview of the required quantitative skills.

It is essential to have:

  • Proven high-level Python data manipulation abilities
  • A demonstrated ability for deploying database storage solutions, such as MongoDB
  • Proven experience handling a complex data pipeline from data ingestion to structured output
  • A solid understanding of Git and collaborative development
  • Proven experience managing the CI/CD (Continuous Integration/Deployment) cycle and real-time logging features

The following are not essential, but highly desirable and worth emphasising in application:

  • Experience in data science research and exploration, including evaluation and deployment of machine learning solutions. Experience in model finetuning is highly appreciated.
  • Understanding of econometrics and statistical techniques
  • Basic frontend framework skills (React, Next.js)

The following personal attributes are desired:

  • A desire to contribute to effective European energy and climate policymaking
  • A passion for creating compelling and intuitive narratives from data
  • A passion for creating order out of unstructured data and the organisational framework required to take the lead on complex data endeavours
  • Self-motivation and the ability to work efficiently independently whilst collaborating within a team

Application procedure

To apply, please submit your application to recruitment@bruegel.org with the subject line: “Data Scientist _Applicant’s name”.

The application must contain the following documents, in one single PDF document (merged):

  • An updated CV;

  • A cover letter (including the candidate’s motivation to work in a European policy think-tank).

Applications with missing documents and/or that do not meet the above-mentioned requirements will NOT be considered.

Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis. First interviews will take place by the end of July.

Because of the high number of applications that we usually receive, we are unfortunately unable to reply to all applicants. Only shortlisted applicants will be contacted within a few weeks.

title: AI/ML Consultant

Processing (NLP), Machine Learning (ML) and/or Artificial Intelligence (AI);
